commit_message:
zuul: Introduce nova-evacuate

This change reworks the evacuation parts of the original
nova-live-migration job into a zuulv3 native ansible role and initial
job covering local ephemeral and iSCSI/LVM volume attached instance
evacuation. Future jobs will cover ceph and other storage backends.

Change-Id: I380e9ca1e6a84da2b2ae577fb48781bf5c740e23

commit_message:
Add Python3 wallaby unit tests

This is an automatically generated patch to ensure unit testing
is in place for all the of the tested runtimes for wallaby.

See also the PTI in governance [1].

[1]: https://governance.openstack.org/tc/reference/project-testing-interface.html

Change-Id: Iecdb1f467ec49a9cf5cf32aaf4e694390c720b7b

subject: Do not skip ports with ofport unset or invalid
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2019-03-01 04:54:13.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/neutron/commit/9a32d92e9e6d10ac7de192aff049028c607ac6b0', 'message': 'do not skip ports with unset or invalid ofport

- This cahnge removes the _check_ofport function
  and its use form the ovs_lib.py file
- By skipping ports without a unique ofport
  in the get_vifs_by_ids and get_vifs_by_id
  functions the ovs l2 agent incorrectly treated
  newly added port with an ofport of -1 as removed ports
  in the treat_devices_added_or_updated function.

commit_message:
Do not skip ports with ofport unset or invalid

This change removes the "_check_ofport" function and its use form
the ovs_lib.py file.

By skipping ports without a unique ofport in the "get_vifs_by_ids"
and "get_vifs_by_id" functions, the OVS agent incorrectly treated
newly added port with an ofport of -1 as removed ports in the
"treat_devices_added_or_updated" function.

Co-Authored-By: Rodolfo Alonso Hernandez <ralonsoh@redhat.com>

Change-Id: I79158baafbb99bee99a1d687039313eb454d3a9b
Partial-Bug: #1734320
Partial-Bug: #1815989

commit_message:
Update TOX_CONSTRAINTS_FILE for stable/victoria

Update the URL to the upper-constraints file to point to the redirect
rule on releases.openstack.org so that anyone working on this branch
will switch to the correct upper-constraints list automatically when
the requirements repository branches.

Until the requirements repository has as stable/victoria branch, tests will
continue to use the upper-constraints list on master.

Change-Id: I8d566697cb4638d0fd1be2ab3fc5c77bb1e55020

commit_message:
autospec for classmethods and staticmethods for Python < 3.7.4

The workaround for allowing autospec for classmethods and
staticmethods is also needed for Python 3.7.3, which is the
version in Debian Buster. Indeed, the patch here:
https://bugs.python.org/issue23078
was commited between the release of Python 3.7.3 and 3.7.4.
See sha: 15a57a3cadb992bb1752302333ff593e7eab284c in the Python
VCS.

Change-Id: I46aedc7a318f2e77ec7e391478bc4e5baf65280e
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/ironic refs/changes/07/754007/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

commit_message:
Use importlib to take place of imp module

The imp module is deprecated[1] since version 3.4, use importlib to
instead

[1]: https://docs.python.org/3/library/imp.html

Change-Id: I0ceb804934d0170d26bbf6dc12f7098b88d2ee6e

commit_message:
[stable-only] Update TOX_CONSTRAINTS_FILE for stable/victoria

Update the URL to the upper-constraints file to point to the redirect
rule on releases.openstack.org so that anyone working on this branch
will switch to the correct upper-constraints list automatically when
the requirements repository branches.

Until the requirements repository has as stable/victoria branch, tests will
continue to use the upper-constraints list on master.

Change-Id: I0bbf37729882a1da000a6bf53e1e81448030f685

commit_message:
ovn migration: Fix neutron server container name

Previously docker command used grep to search for neutron server
container. It used image name instead of container name. With the switch
to podman, it stopped working. This patch fixes the container name.

Change-Id: Id650c2e7ac427dd53ebaab4e6d95d54efc657e3f
Closes-bug: #1895108
Signed-off-by: Jakub Libosvar <libosvar@redhat.com>
(cherry picked from commit 4b30dc2330423fd9fe68a70f7b2e0c6f925ecda4)

commit_message:
Do not fail deleting namespace if it does not exist

Note: this is a squash of two changes since they are
dependent on each other, and are currently blocking
the gate queue.

Sometimes cleanup methods are failing in the check and
gate queues trying to delete non-existing namespaces.
Since they could have been deleted asynchronously, don't
raise if the failure is "No such file or directory" since
the system is in the intended state.

Cleaned-up the DHCP agent to longer check for existence
first, and the tests to longer mock-out the namespace
exists check.

Fix test_legacy_router_lifecycle failures

Multi-path routes returned via the pyroute2 library have
their outgoing interfaces in the 'multipath' dictionary
element, not in the route dictionary.  In that case return
all the multipath routes correctly.

Change-Id: I5415cb3a88ff2640a19598a1fcb2278388815343
Closes-bug: #1795482
Closes-bug: #1795548

commit_message:
Run tempest install when tempest_run is False

We should run tempest installation when tempest_run is false. We shouldn't
run it only when tempest_install is False.

Change-Id: I1a3943fd0ae536b72555ef0f74836f0168ce6a21

commit_message:
[Storwize]:Fix delete_group_snapshot cleanup issue

delete_group_snapshot doesn't handle flash copy consistency
group cleanup properly.
In case of multiple snapshots in the group,existing code exits
if any one snapshot deletion fails, but it should update error
state and continue with deleting other snapshots.

closes bug: #1890241

Change-Id: I87c9f35f34c94bff3ada7d428cd963fc8703a2ad

'}, {'number': 3, 'created': '2020-09-23 07:48:51.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/openstack-helm-infra/commit/4bdb01188148476d7fb4ce207568c6ea6eec9933', 'message': 'HTK: Add extra DNS names to Ingress

The existing helm-toolkit function "helm-toolkit.manifests.ingress"
will create namespace-fqdn and cluster-fqdn Ingress object when the
host_fqdn_override parameter is used, but only for a single hostname.

This change allows additional FQDNs to be associated with the same
Ingress, including the names defined in the list:

    endpoints.$service.host_fqdn_override.$endpoint.tls.dnsNames

For example:

    endpoints:
      grafana:
        host_fqdn_override:
          public:
            host: grafana.openstackhelm.example
            tls:
              dnsNames:
                - grafana-alt.openstackhelm.example

Will produce the following:

      spec:
        tls:
          - secretName: grafana-tls-public
            hosts:
              - grafana.openstackhelm.example
              - grafana-alt.openstackhelm.example
        rules:
          - host: grafana.openstackhelm.example
            http:
              # ...
          - host: grafana-alt.openstackhelm.example
            http:
              # ...

Change-Id: I9b068f10d25923bf61220112da98d6fbfdf7ef8a

commit_message:
Add extra DNS names to Ingress (helm-toolkit 0.1.1)

The existing helm-toolkit function "helm-toolkit.manifests.ingress"
will create namespace-fqdn and cluster-fqdn Ingress objects when the
host_fqdn_override parameter is used, but only for a single hostname.

This change allows additional FQDNs to be associated with the same
Ingress, including the names defined in the list:

    endpoints.$service.host_fqdn_override.$endpoint.tls.dnsNames

For example:

    endpoints:
      grafana:
        host_fqdn_override:
          public:
            host: grafana.openstackhelm.example
            tls:
              dnsNames:
                - grafana-alt.openstackhelm.example

Will produce the following:

      spec:
        tls:
          - secretName: grafana-tls-public
            hosts:
              - grafana.openstackhelm.example
              - grafana-alt.openstackhelm.example
        rules:
          - host: grafana.openstackhelm.example
            http:
              # ...
          - host: grafana-alt.openstackhelm.example
            http:
              # ...

Change-Id: I9b068f10d25923bf61220112da98d6fbfdf7ef8a

Change image_source from kolla to tripleo

The neutron-metadata-agent container image
is not getting build as [1] changed it's type to kolla..
Here changing the image_source method from kolla
to tripleo.

[1]: https://review.opendev.org/#/c/748691/7

commit_message:
Fix keystone-startup.sh

keystone-startup.sh is using fernet_token_expiry instead of
fernet_key_rotation_interval - which effects in restart loop of keystone
containers - when restarted after 2-3 days.

Closes-Bug: #1895723

Change-Id: Ifff77af3d25d9dc659fff34f2ae3c6f2670df0f4
(cherry picked from commit d78673e77fc376274192a8f7b547ce90d6bdc151)

is that on the OpenInfra gate VMs we often see degraded storage

commit_message:
DevStack: Disable leader election for K8s services

The DevStack plugin is really designed just for gate testing and
developer usage. In both use cases normally we won't run K8s services on
multiple nodes. Because of that this commit disables leader election for
kube-scheduler and kube-controller-manager. The motivation behind this
is that on the OpenInfra gate VMs we often see degraded storage
performance that affects etcd. If that happens during leader-election of
a service, it'll crash, leaving us with broken and unrecoverable K8s.
This should eliminate the issue.

Change-Id: Ib84ed289c9aaf3ae27af1c7ffa8aab2f8ba48671
(cherry picked from commit acfe74957442eabcb2922493ade37c5eadf98cf7)

commit_message:
Update TOX_CONSTRAINTS_FILE for stable/victoria

Update the URL to the upper-constraints file to point to the redirect
rule on releases.openstack.org so that anyone working on this branch
will switch to the correct upper-constraints list automatically when
the requirements repository branches.

Until the requirements repository has as stable/victoria branch, tests will
continue to use the upper-constraints list on master.

Change-Id: I02486cfa6b7165076d8d556535551e434f324bb2
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/octavia refs/changes/12/754312/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

subject: Use appropriate allocation pools for StorageNFS
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2020-09-23 12:42:46.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/tripleo-heat-templates/commit/a2aac9dc75a0aaa7f4419eda23061c807e8558a5', 'message': "Use appropriate allocation pools for StorageNFS

The StorageNFS network was defined in network_data_ganesha.yaml
using allocation ranges that mirrored those of the other isolated
networks.  But TripleO and the undercloud only need to use a small
number of addresses for overcloud deployment -- in the default
three-controller case, one for the regular StorageNFS interface on
each ControllerNfs role node, and one for the VIP on which the NFS
service is offered.  The bulk of the addresses in the StorageNFS CIDR
should be left out of the allocation range defined in network_data
so that they can be used by the allocation pool for the overcloud
Netron StorageNFS provider network's subnet without danger of
overlap.

This change uses a CIDR with a shorter prefix so that there will
be sufficient IPs left over after the undercloud's TripleO allocation
pool to deploy almost 4000 clients on the Neutron StorageNFS provider
network's subnet.

This commit also includes some minor changes to synchronize
network_data_ganesha.yaml with network_data.yaml since the former
was derived from the latter and should differ from it only by
inclustion of the StorageNFS network.

Closes-bug: #1889682

Change-Id: Ibb50dad42ec3dc154cd27ae9094a9be5d0a2dd28
(cherry picked from commit 4e8a05833cb9679bc6140839305d075389dc4822)

commit_message:
Use appropriate allocation pools for StorageNFS

The StorageNFS network was defined in network_data_ganesha.yaml
using allocation ranges that mirrored those of the other isolated
networks.  But TripleO and the undercloud only need to use a small
number of addresses for overcloud deployment -- in the default
three-controller case, one for the regular StorageNFS interface on
each ControllerNfs role node, and one for the VIP on which the NFS
service is offered.  The bulk of the addresses in the StorageNFS CIDR
should be left out of the allocation range defined in network_data
so that they can be used by the allocation pool for the overcloud
Netron StorageNFS provider network's subnet without danger of
overlap.

This change uses a CIDR with a shorter prefix so that there will
be sufficient IPs left over after the undercloud's TripleO allocation
pool to deploy almost 4000 clients on the Neutron StorageNFS provider
network's subnet.

This commit also includes some minor changes to synchronize
network_data_ganesha.yaml with network_data.yaml since the former
was derived from the latter and should differ from it only by
inclustion of the StorageNFS network.

Closes-bug: #1889682

Change-Id: Ibb50dad42ec3dc154cd27ae9094a9be5d0a2dd28
(cherry picked from commit 4e8a05833cb9679bc6140839305d075389dc4822)
(cherry picked from commit 6efb29dcc7294a289a78cf380b14eaf146a1a49e)
(cherry picked from commit 688b59301dd880bc15da7539dd9c5b7946903346)

git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/tripleo-heat-templates refs/changes/08/753608/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: --- upgrade: - | The CIDR for the StorageNFS network in the sample network_data_ganesha.yaml file has been modified to provide more usable IPs for the corresponding Neutron overcloud StorageNFS provider network. Since the CIDR of an existing network cannot be modified, deployments with existing StorageNFS networks should be sure to customize the StorageNFS network definition to use the same CIDR as that in their existing deployment in order to avoid a heat resource failure when updating or upgrading the overcloud. fixes: - | Fixed issue in the sample network_data_ganesha.yaml file where the IPv4 allocation range for the StorageNFS network occupies almost the whole of its CIDR. If network_data_ganesha.yaml is used without modification in a customer deployment then there are too few IPs left over in its CIDR for use by the corresponding overcloud Neutron StorageNFS provider network for its overcloud DHCP service. (See `bug: #1889682 <https://bugs.launchpad.net/tripleo/+bug/1889682>`_)

commit_message:
Another shot on cleanup of shell executions

Unite executable to /usr/bin/bash and make sure
workdir variable is set.

Make sure ping script in l3 check pipes both stdout and
stderr into it's own log.

Change-Id: Ied75c8732bbcfbc29ef56602f0c0f5a1cbb2e234

commit_message:
Update master for stable/victoria

Add file to the reno documentation build to show release notes for
stable/victoria.

Use pbr instruction to increment the minor version number
automatically so that master versions are higher than the versions on
stable/victoria.

Change-Id: Ibc14026c757b424c36dc2b1ed356c2e62e36499e
Sem-Ver: feature

commit_message:
Ignore DELETED amphorae when performing certificate rotation

Deleted amphorae should not be included when housekeeping service is
performing certificate rotation. Otherwise, deleted amphorae will
become ERROR.

Story: #2007635
Task: #39681

Change-Id: Ie2c748ff69c8fd736e9c67d686068a33d803222e
(cherry picked from commit f3eff29ce17e5d27867b6e6f4049ae6d51d2751c)

commit_message:
Switch to tripleoci based quay docker registry image

quay.io/tripleoci/registry:2 is added to quay.io in order
to reduce the dependency on docker.

We are switching to quay registry based tripleoci/registry:2.

Signed-off-by: Chandan Kumar (raukadah) <chkumar@redhat.com>

Change-Id: I9d28f2fde0cae597c1d4808e0bafb1c90c2ceabc

commit_message:
[Train only] Add missing stop service steps for FFU.

We observed, when running the system_upgrade_transfer_data that few OSP
services which are still present in Train keep running before the database
backup is restored on the newly upgraded controller. This could cause some
discrepancies between the restored state and the cluster one.

Adding all the identified services present in both versions (deprecated
services will be stopped when upgrading the old nodes operating system).

Change-Id: I43e0d04866f6ce37be5de8b68aac6d43e165dc76
Closes-Bug: #1894238

commit_message:
[queens-only] Allow rhos-release parameters for UC RHEL in FFU

When upgrading the Undercloud in the FFU procedure a sequential
upgrade is carried out. If using rhos-release, the currently
running version of RHEL is used as the default.

This may be fine, but if we want to change that there is currently
no way of doing so.

This patch allows the ffu_undercloud_repo_args to optionally include
the appropriate default parameters needed for rhos-release and sets
them for the role execution. These parameters would be passed to
tripleo-upgrade via an extra var.

This is queens-only due to this whole mechanism being different in
later branches.

We also now remove the ffu_undercloud_repo_args/rhos_release bits
from defaults because they can be provided in the extra var from
outside instead.

Change-Id: I8284daebd4ddd5cb48ad2e2f510d688203dd8357

commit_message:
pytype: Resolve final issues with 'nova.virt'

Some functions can return None but we always expected a set. Ensure that
only a set is actually returned. In addition, correct some of the type
annotations I'd added previously which turned out to be wrong.

Change-Id: I9a80cda1527f132cf8e9b54a4420f806cddf518f
Signed-off-by: Stephen Finucane <sfinucan@redhat.com>

commit_message:
pytype: Resolve issues with 'nova.virt.xenapi'

Bugs! A few of them, in fact. Many of them are to do with the unhandled
possibility that a value might be unset and we need to handle it, while
yet more are to do with us overusing the peculiar behavior that Python
has when a loop variable exists outside of the scope of the loop but
only if the variable executed. The crucial one though is the fact that
we call 'unplug_vifs' with incorrect parameters. Looking at things, it
seems the 'unplug_vifs' call is mostly unused across drivers and could
be removed, but we'll defer that work til later.

In addition, the 'fake' module does a lot of monkey patching that
thoroughly confuses the type checker. Since this is only used in tests,
the entire module is moved to the tests directory.

Change-Id: I846760be9dccb0b3db481515376cb787d174ecbb
Signed-off-by: Stephen Finucane <sfinucan@redhat.com>

added_lines: from nova import objects # type: ignore if isinstance(response, dict): return response.get("power_action", response) return response # Ensure only guest instances are migrated uuid = vm_rec['other_config'].get('nova_uuid') if not uuid: name = vm_rec['name_label'] uuid = _uuid_find(ctxt, host, name) if not uuid: LOG.info('Instance %(name)s running on ' '%(host)s could not be found in ' 'the database: assuming it is a ' 'worker VM and skip ping migration ' 'to a new host', {'name': name, 'host': host}) continue instance = objects.Instance.get_by_uuid(ctxt, uuid) vm_counter = vm_counter + 1 aggregate = objects.AggregateList.get_by_host( ctxt, host, key=pool_states.POOL_FLAG) if not aggregate: msg = _('Aggregate for host %(host)s count not be' ' found.') % dict(host=host) raise exception.NotFound(msg) dest = _host_find(ctxt, self._session, aggregate[0], host_ref) instance.host = dest instance.task_state = task_states.MIGRATING instance.save() try: if response: return response.get("status", response) return response if response: return response.get("uptime", response) return response if (data.get('host_hostname') != {'old': self._stats.get('host_hostname'), data['host_hostname'] = self._stats.get('host_hostname') data['hypervisor_hostname'] = data.get('host_hostname') return {}
deleted_lines: from nova import objects return response.get("power_action", response) try: # Ensure only guest instances are migrated uuid = vm_rec['other_config'].get('nova_uuid') if not uuid: name = vm_rec['name_label'] uuid = _uuid_find(ctxt, host, name) if not uuid: LOG.info('Instance %(name)s running on ' '%(host)s could not be found in ' 'the database: assuming it is a ' 'worker VM and skip ping migration ' 'to a new host', {'name': name, 'host': host}) continue instance = objects.Instance.get_by_uuid(ctxt, uuid) vm_counter = vm_counter + 1 aggregate = objects.AggregateList.get_by_host( ctxt, host, key=pool_states.POOL_FLAG) if not aggregate: msg = _('Aggregate for host %(host)s count not be' ' found.') % dict(host=host) raise exception.NotFound(msg) dest = _host_find(ctxt, self._session, aggregate[0], host_ref) instance.host = dest instance.task_state = task_states.MIGRATING instance.save() return response.get("status", response) return response.get("uptime", response) if (data['host_hostname'] != {'old': self._stats['host_hostname'], data['host_hostname'] = self._stats['host_hostname'] data['hypervisor_hostname'] = data['host_hostname'] return ''

commit_message:
pytype: Resolve issues with 'nova.virt.powervm'

We need to declare variables since they're not configured in '__init__'
but in a later function.

Change-Id: I4594a6f5e4573b08467d135ac151432b00edafd6
Signed-off-by: Stephen Finucane <sfinucan@redhat.com>

commit_message:
pytype: Resolve issues with 'nova.virt.vmwareapi'

A bit of static checker-related noise, but this highlights some
edgecases where we could conceivably get null results that we weren't
handling correctly. Handle those.

Change-Id: Ib610e8a03bf6e3b964bef18ea4009ce96cc46905
Signed-off-by: Stephen Finucane <sfinucan@redhat.com>

code - without requiring type annotations." [1] We can use it as a

Start using this on the libvirt issue. This requires a few non-fix

at this early stage it does highlight some actual issues with our code

commit_message:
pytype: Resolve issues with 'nova.virt.libvirt'

pytype is a type checker that "checks and infers types for your Python
code - without requiring type annotations." [1] We can use it as a
prerequisite or alternative to adding type hints and weed out some
issues.

Start using this on the libvirt issue. This requires a few non-fix
changes, mostly around ordering to avoid overuse of 'setattr' and
'getattr', but even at this early stage it does highlight some actual
issues with our code and the types expected.

[1] https://github.com/google/pytype

Change-Id: Iffb5bff57e96dbcdbc9910b1595214ba6ee4e009
Signed-off-by: Stephen Finucane <sfinucan@redhat.com>

CI: Test Senlin

Partially-implements: blueprint kolla-deployment-scenario-testing
Change-Id: Id36552d3c7bbce714e3400b8a94c178e18c022ee
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/kolla-ansible refs/changes/36/697136/3 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: if [[ $SCENARIO == senlin ]]; then ~/openstackclient-venv/bin/pip install python-senlinclient fi if [[ $SCENARIO == "senlin" ]]; then GATE_IMAGES+="cron,fluentd,haproxy,keepalived,keystone,kolla-toolbox,mariadb,memcached,rabbitmq,horizon,chrony,senlin" fi

commit_message:
Update hacking for Python3

The repo is Python 3 now, so update hacking to version 3.0 which
supports Python 3.

Update local hacking checks for new flake8.

Remove hacking and friends from lower-constraints, they are not needed
for installation.

Change-Id: Ib6f30427e736ff488598e80e87ce0a8b39e92f33
(cherry picked from commit 4f8b5ea08bdaa0ad645005ac2acc50d788a50d5a)
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/heat-dashboard refs/changes/20/724820/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
deleted_lines: # Temporary disabled to pass the pep8 job # [hacking] # local-check-factory = horizon.hacking.checks.factory

commit_message:
Add description change during project decommission

Let's mark the repository as DEPRECATED so that it is shown as such
in listings.

This is an adapted part of step 3 from the retirement procedure.

Change-Id: Icb502308de9d230a7457059b163e4c07b5195614
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/project-team-guide refs/changes/84/749684/4 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: Step 2d: Mark the project as retired in Gerrit ~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~ Prepare another change to the ``openstack/project-config`` repository. Adjust the project description. Find the entry for your project in ``gerrit/projects.yaml`` and look for the line which defines the description, prefix it with ``RETIRED, ``:: description: RETIRED, existing project description

commit_message:
Use the UBI8 image for testing

This change converts our use of CentOS7/88 to UBI8, which should
provide a better test environment which will match that of
production for future releases of TripleO. While this image change
will better match production clouds thanks in large part to TCIB,
it will also remove our use of docker.io (dockerhub) which fraught
with peril due to the ongoing API rate limits saga.

Story: 2006061
Task: 34774

Change-Id: I067046e5fd4d56cd88712f553e25a61db60ced7f
Signed-off-by: Kevin Carter <kecarter@redhat.com>

commit_message:
Update TOX_CONSTRAINTS_FILE for stable/victoria

Update the URL to the upper-constraints file to point to the redirect
rule on releases.openstack.org so that anyone working on this branch
will switch to the correct upper-constraints list automatically when
the requirements repository branches.

Until the requirements repository has as stable/victoria branch, tests will
continue to use the upper-constraints list on master.

Change-Id: I7bfdb770cce7fa9ff79efa9164114001151b9603

commit_message:
Add a cleanup for a server in a functional test

A VM instance is created in the following functional test.

* novaclient.tests.functional.v2.test_instance_action.
  TestInstanceActionCLIV262.test_show_actions_with_host

However the VM instance is not deleted after the functional test.
Add a cleanup for the server in the functional test.

Change-Id: I8c2a6f91739d50baa283b37b16de67c542ea691b
Closes-Bug: #1889283
Signed-off-by: Takashi Natsume <takanattie@gmail.com>
(cherry picked from commit 1ce9edcd73c6da9dd4dcded12747957fc297cb21)

commit_message:
Don't use ansible 2.10.0

It seems to have broken all jobs, let's not use it till we
fix those.

Also pin importlib-metadata 2.0.0 which is not compatible
with virtualenv 20.0.31.

Related-Bug: #1896738
Change-Id: I696605e312692b24059178b82446d947023f35d9

commit_message:
Don't use ansible 2.10.0

It seems to have broken all jobs, let's not use it till we
fix those.

Also pin importlib-metadata 2.0.0 which is not compatible
with virtualenv 20.0.31.

Related-Bug: #1896738
Change-Id: I696605e312692b24059178b82446d947023f35d9
(cherry picked from commit d37dfddff3c07c03e911c02b0ff96b7da188cf33)

revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2020-05-27 17:13:51.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/barbican/commit/108da8453c5abc32248a609d2c9378fc156f693d', 'message': 'DNM: Workaround issues with MySQL 8.x and alembic

I'm seeing the following issue on an Ubuntu 20.04-based DevStack
deployment:

  "Check constraint 'secret_acls_chk_1' uses column 'creator_only', hence column cannot be dropped or renamed."

The root cause appears to be a bug in alembic [1]. Disabling constraints
for now to work around the issue.

[1] https://github.com/sqlalchemy/alembic/issues/699

Change-Id: I678d067be9a412212ec57ec3900aeecf3c6b6198
Signed-off-by: Stephen Finucane <stephenfin@redhat.com>

commit_message:
Resolve issues with MySQL 8.x and alembic

Attempting to deploy Barbican on Ubuntu 20.04 yields the following
error:

  "Check constraint 'secret_acls_chk_1' uses column 'creator_only', hence column cannot be dropped or renamed."

The root cause is a bug in alembic [1] and it appears this will be
difficult if not impossible to resolve there. Disabling constraints is
the recommended solution so do just that.

[1] https://github.com/sqlalchemy/alembic/issues/699

Change-Id: I678d067be9a412212ec57ec3900aeecf3c6b6198
Signed-off-by: Stephen Finucane <stephenfin@redhat.com>
Story: #2007732
Task: #39896

rule on releases.openstack.org so that anyone working on this branch

the requirements repository branches.

commit_message:
Update TOX_CONSTRAINTS_FILE for stable/victoria

Update the URL to the upper-constraints file to point to the redirect
rule on releases.openstack.org so that anyone working on this branch
will switch to the correct upper-constraints list automatically when
the requirements repository branches.

Until the requirements repository has as stable/victoria branch, tests will
continue to use the upper-constraints list on master.

Change-Id: I863817a949ce94a5dc785c603228a39a1d6edb0c

commit_message:
libvirt: Remove MIN_LIBVIRT_FILE_BACKED_DISCARD_VERSION

I8e349849db0b1a540d295c903f1470917b82fd97 has bumped MIN_LIBVIRT_VERSION
past this so remove the constant and associated logic.

Change-Id: I952f36fe201aad37297c7630ed562b579c90f64a

commit_message:
Use absolute path during qemu img rebase

During an assisted volume snapshot delete request from Cinder nova
removes the snapshot from the backing file chain. During that nova
checks the existence of such file. However in some cases (see the bug
report) the path is relative and therefore os.path.exists fails.

This patch makes sure that nova uses the volume absolute path to make
the backing file path absolute as well.

Closes-Bug #1885528

Change-Id: I58dca95251b607eaff602783fee2fc38e2421944

subject: Move revert resize under semaphore
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2020-09-11 16:32:08.000000000', 'files': ['nova/tests/unit/compute/test_compute_mgr.py', 'nova/tests/unit/compute/test_resource_tracker.py', 'nova/tests/functional/integrated_helpers.py', 'nova/tests/unit/compute/test_compute.py', 'nova/tests/functional/regressions/test_bug_1879878.py', 'nova/compute/manager.py', 'nova/compute/resource_tracker.py'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/nova/commit/79a467e1cfa05b1c281e592e69549716c11892e5', 'message': "Move revert resize under semaphore

As discussed in change I26b050c402f5721fc490126e9becb643af9279b4, the
resource tracker's periodic task is reliant on the status of migrations
to determine whether to include usage from these migrations in the
total, and races between setting the migration status and decrementing
resource usage via 'drop_move_claim' can result in incorrect usage.
That change tackled the confirm resize operation. This one changes the
revert resize operation, and is a little trickier due to kinks in how
both the same-cell and cross-cell resize revert operations work.

For same-cell resize revert, the 'ComputeManager.revert_resize'
function, running on the destination host, sets the migration status to
'reverted' before dropping the move claim. This exposes the same race
that we previously saw with the confirm resize operation. It then calls
back to 'ComputeManager.finish_revert_resize' on the source host to boot
up the instance itself. This is kind of weird, because, even ignoring
the race, we're marking the migration as 'reverted' before we've done
any of the necessary work on the source host.

The cross-cell resize revert splits dropping of the move claim and
setting of the migration status between the source and destination host
tasks. Specifically, we do cleanup on the destination and drop the move
claim first, via 'ComputeManager.revert_snapshot_based_resize_at_dest'
before resuming the instance and setting the migration status on the
source via
'ComputeManager.finish_revert_snapshot_based_resize_at_source'. This
would appear to avoid the weird quirk of same-cell migration, however,
in typical weird cross-cell fashion, these are actually different
instances and different migration records.

The solution is once again to move the setting of the migration status
and the dropping of the claim under 'COMPUTE_RESOURCE_SEMAPHORE'. This
introduces the weird setting of migration status before completion to
the cross-cell resize case and perpetuates it in the same-cell case, but
this seems like a suitable compromise to avoid attempts to do things
like unplugging already unplugged PCI devices or unpinning already
unpinned CPUs. From an end-user perspective, instance state changes are
what really matter and once a revert is completed on the destination
host and the instance has been marked as having returned to the source
host, hard reboots can help us resolve any remaining issues.

Change-Id: I29d6f4a78c0206385a550967ce244794e71cef6d
Signed-off-by: Stephen Finucane <stephenfin@redhat.com>
Closes-Bug: #1879878
(cherry picked from commit dc9c7a5ebf11253f86127238d33dff7401465155)
"}]
commit_message:
Move revert resize under semaphore

As discussed in change I26b050c402f5721fc490126e9becb643af9279b4, the
resource tracker's periodic task is reliant on the status of migrations
to determine whether to include usage from these migrations in the
total, and races between setting the migration status and decrementing
resource usage via 'drop_move_claim' can result in incorrect usage.
That change tackled the confirm resize operation. This one changes the
revert resize operation, and is a little trickier due to kinks in how
both the same-cell and cross-cell resize revert operations work.

For same-cell resize revert, the 'ComputeManager.revert_resize'
function, running on the destination host, sets the migration status to
'reverted' before dropping the move claim. This exposes the same race
that we previously saw with the confirm resize operation. It then calls
back to 'ComputeManager.finish_revert_resize' on the source host to boot
up the instance itself. This is kind of weird, because, even ignoring
the race, we're marking the migration as 'reverted' before we've done
any of the necessary work on the source host.

The cross-cell resize revert splits dropping of the move claim and
setting of the migration status between the source and destination host
tasks. Specifically, we do cleanup on the destination and drop the move
claim first, via 'ComputeManager.revert_snapshot_based_resize_at_dest'
before resuming the instance and setting the migration status on the
source via
'ComputeManager.finish_revert_snapshot_based_resize_at_source'. This
would appear to avoid the weird quirk of same-cell migration, however,
in typical weird cross-cell fashion, these are actually different
instances and different migration records.

The solution is once again to move the setting of the migration status
and the dropping of the claim under 'COMPUTE_RESOURCE_SEMAPHORE'. This
introduces the weird setting of migration status before completion to
the cross-cell resize case and perpetuates it in the same-cell case, but
this seems like a suitable compromise to avoid attempts to do things
like unplugging already unplugged PCI devices or unpinning already
unpinned CPUs. From an end-user perspective, instance state changes are
what really matter and once a revert is completed on the destination
host and the instance has been marked as having returned to the source
host, hard reboots can help us resolve any remaining issues.

Change-Id: I29d6f4a78c0206385a550967ce244794e71cef6d
Signed-off-by: Stephen Finucane <stephenfin@redhat.com>
Closes-Bug: #1879878
(cherry picked from commit dc9c7a5ebf11253f86127238d33dff7401465155)
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/nova refs/changes/54/751354/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: def drop_move_claim_at_dest(self, context, instance, migration): """Drop a move claim after reverting a resize or cold migration.""" # NOTE(stephenfin): This runs on the destination, before we return to # the source and resume the instance there. As such, the migration # isn't really really reverted yet, but this status is what we use to # indicate that we no longer needs to account for usage on this host migration.status = 'reverted' migration.save() self._drop_move_claim( context, instance, migration.dest_node, instance.new_flavor, prefix='new_') instance.revert_migration_context() instance.save(expected_task_state=[task_states.RESIZE_REVERTING]) @utils.synchronized(COMPUTE_RESOURCE_SEMAPHORE, fair=True)

Update UPPER_CONSTRAINTS_FILE for stable/stein

Update the URL to the upper-constraints file to point to the redirect
rule on releases.openstack.org so that anyone working on this branch
will switch to the correct upper-constraints list automatically when
the requirements repository branches.

Until the requirements repository has as stable/stein branch, tests will
continue to use the upper-constraints list on master.

Change-Id: Ic3d011876a9920d35ddfec900317d60751064f70

commit_message:
Bump the openstackdocstheme extension to 1.20

Some options are now automatically configured by the version 1.20:
- project
- html_last_updated_fmt
- latex_engine
- latex_elements
- version
- release.

commit_message:
Remove DHCP agent scheduling when subnet created

Historically, there was workaround in DHCP agent scheduling [1]. Now,
provisioning_block assure right order of port activeness so it's good
time to delete workaround

For routed network, we have DHCP agent to be scheduled at creating
subnet since segment has host bindings. Schedule only for the case
using 'candidate_hosts' rather than all subnets.

[1] https://bugs.launchpad.net/neutron/+bug/1431105

Change-Id: I787e02167d0ff690e0ba9c06d7f00f82328e2e2f

subject: objects/agent: Remove group_by from agent query
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2019-11-08 14:08:23.000000000', 'files': ['neutron/objects/agent.py'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/neutron/commit/c483d3a8069b15aa79d0d3672985ea9f96f6c18e', 'message': 'objects/agent: Remove group_by from agent query

The query select all fields from the table and having a group by in this
case only works on MySQL, but breaks on PostgreSQL with:

ERROR neutron.pecan_wsgi.hooks.translation oslo_db.exception.DBError: (psycopg2.errors.GroupingError) column "agents.id" must appear in the GROUP BY clause or be used in an aggregate function
ERROR neutron.pecan_wsgi.hooks.translation LINE 1: SELECT agents.id AS agents_id, agents.agent_type AS agents_a...

Based on the function's name it shouldn't do any grouping and return all
agents. For the only caller this group by is kind of an optimization,
but the caller also does deduplication, so let's just remove it.

Change-Id: Ibe3034e93d3b6ee3a2b95fbb641f3a80d8e597c0
Signed-off-by: Sven Wegener <sven.wegener@inovex.de>
'}]
commit_message:
objects/agent: Remove group_by from agent query

The query select all fields from the table and having a group by in this
case only works on MySQL, but breaks on PostgreSQL with:

ERROR neutron.pecan_wsgi.hooks.translation oslo_db.exception.DBError: (psycopg2.errors.GroupingError) column "agents.id" must appear in the GROUP BY clause or be used in an aggregate function
ERROR neutron.pecan_wsgi.hooks.translation LINE 1: SELECT agents.id AS agents_id, agents.agent_type AS agents_a...

Based on the function's name it shouldn't do any grouping and return all
agents. For the only caller this group by is kind of an optimization,
but the caller also does deduplication, so let's just remove it.

Change-Id: Ibe3034e93d3b6ee3a2b95fbb641f3a80d8e597c0
Signed-off-by: Sven Wegener <sven.wegener@inovex.de>

commit_message:
Remove *-uwsgi jobs and add scenario job with eventlet

As we decided in Shanghai PTG, we want to switch default deployment
method of Neutron to be uwsgi now. This is done in [1].
This commit removes functional/fullstack jobs with uwsgi and replaces
tempest-uwsgi job with opposite job tempest-eventlet as since now
all other jobs will by default be run with uwsgi.

[1] https://review.opendev.org/694042

Depends-On: https://review.opendev.org/694042
Change-Id: I4e691132d26f639fc529b875d681f7bb13ec0159

subject: Don't advertise reserved DHCP ports as DNS servers
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2019-11-19 00:09:33.000000000', 'files': ['neutron/agent/linux/dhcp.py'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/neutron/commit/4c7eb88fc8fa17bd4ae963622bf21bceb88ee84f', 'message': "Don't advertise reserved DHCP ports as DNS servers

DHCP ports marked 'reserved_dhcp_port' need to be excluded from the list
of nameservers that the DHCP server advertises to a VM. Given that
resolv.conf only uses upto 3 nameservers, it is possible that VMs will
have their name resolution broken if there are more than 3 DHCP ports
marked reserved_dhcp_port. This change excludes these ports from the
list of nameservers advertised to instances.

Change-Id: Ib1fb87874cb9f759883a2aaa3db39c0717dd5472
Closes-Bug: #1852504
"}]
commit_message:
Don't advertise reserved DHCP ports as DNS servers

DHCP ports marked 'reserved_dhcp_port' need to be excluded from the list
of nameservers that the DHCP server advertises to a VM. Given that
resolv.conf only uses upto 3 nameservers, it is possible that VMs will
have their name resolution broken if there are more than 3 DHCP ports
marked reserved_dhcp_port. This change excludes these ports from the
list of nameservers advertised to instances.

Change-Id: Ib1fb87874cb9f759883a2aaa3db39c0717dd5472
Closes-Bug: #1852504

commit_message:
add optional argument metric to set metric for routes

A routing metric is a quantitative value used to evaluate
the path cost. A new optional argument metric can be added
to set the metric for the routes. This value can be set by
the user or have a default value.

DocImpact
Closes-Bug: #1759790
Implements: [RFE] metric for the route

Depends-On: Ic4a16953f3c5b65358c79f3472989fb90edc72a0
Change-Id: I64c26269dd3f00756d0361e16534ac6145706a42
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/neutron refs/changes/85/639585/34 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: 'nexthop': obj_fields.IPAddressField(), 'metric': obj_fields.IntegerField(default=0) if 'metric' in result: result['metric'] = cls.filter_to_str(result['metric'])

subject: Fix designate driver not being fully region aware
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2019-12-02 17:23:48.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/neutron/commit/1ac46401ad16fa7611b8f72d3219c00867294886', 'message': "Fix designate driver not being fully region aware

The admin part of the designate implementation, never
passes the region or url to client. This means that it
may fail in multi-region situations.

We fix this by always passing the endpoint
override to the client every-time it's instantiated.

(cherry picked from commit 654c1f06d583965c4b5a2ae721a7b1f3786dc76a)

Closes-Bug: #1853632
Signed-off-by: Manuel Torrinha <manuel.torrinha@tecnico.ulisboa.pt>
"}, {'number': 2, 'created': '2019-12-02 20:13:12.000000000', 'files': ['neutron/services/externaldns/drivers/designate/driver.py', 'neutron/conf/services/extdns_designate_driver.py'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/neutron/commit/27bb9f2e49fa6f0f047416c3367d84c99cf9cf6d', 'message': "Fix designate driver not being fully region aware

commit_message:
Fix designate driver not being fully region aware

The admin part of the designate implementation, never
passes the region or url to client. This means that it
may fail in multi-region situations.

We fix this by always passing the endpoint
override to the client every-time it's instantiated.

(cherry picked from commit 654c1f06d583965c4b5a2ae721a7b1f3786dc76a)

Adds required auth config
Add support for missing designate configuration options
Adds domain settings to designate external dns driver

Change-Id: Ie00467412d2cbe21e312b260d1d5470442d4dfaf
Closes-Bug: #1853632
Signed-off-by: Manuel Torrinha <manuel.torrinha@tecnico.ulisboa.pt>
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/neutron refs/changes/34/696934/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: project_domain_name=CONF.designate.project_domain_name, project_name=CONF.designate.project_name, user_domain_name = CONF.designate.user_domain_name, tenant_id=CONF.designate.admin_tenant_id, project_domain_name=CONF.designate.project_domain_name, project_name=CONF.designate.project_name, user_domain_name = CONF.designate.user_domain_name) admin_client = d_client.Client(session=_SESSION, auth=admin_auth, endpoint_override=CONF.designate.url)

commit_message:
Filter ports based on subnet segment IDs

Changed get_network_info() and get_active_networks_info()
to filter ports based on subnet segment IDs.

If we don't, a failure can occur if the DHCP agent is
stopped, namespaces are cleaned-up and the agent restarted,
leading to the tracebacks in the bug.

Change-Id: I47707e63bdde6b71947e19242a4a52ecc4ed3262
Closes-bug: #1849726

commit_message:
Use new_facade for DB in Agent and Port related objects

This is causing DB Deadlock issues and neutron-server to stop heartbeating with Rabbit.
Enable new_facade in the Agent class, and in every class in ports.py except PortDNS.

Change-Id: Ief73affd492d8424380343f92ad4e6f4e067062a
Closes-Bug: #1853071

commit_message:
[ci] Propose to run rally workload to check concurrent subnets remove

This workload was failing recently at Rally CI, detecting an issue with
BadRequest.
It would be nice to run it at neutron's CI as well to increase test coverage

Change-Id: I291f19f887753cee5f735685cf612e362a402a12

commit_message:
Use new_facade for DB in Agent and Port related objects

This is causing DB Deadlock issues and neutron-server to stop heartbeating with Rabbit.
Enable new_facade in the Agent class, and in every class in ports.py except PortDNS.

Change-Id: Ief73affd492d8424380343f92ad4e6f4e067062a
Closes-Bug: #1853071

subject: Support encapsulated DHCP options
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2019-09-11 12:54:51.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/neutron/commit/2c95b8336b77d9bcbe1b57b9d79524d94b65a9ae', 'message': "Support encapsulated DHCP options

Some PXE implementations, including iPXE, use vendor-specific options
encapsulated in a single top-level option to send configuration data in
DHCP packets. As an example, iPXE encapsulates various options in option
175.

This is fully supported by dnsmasq (see below), however, the original
code which translates a DHCP option name and value into a dnsmasq
command-line argument would expect any non-numeric option 'name' to be a
named option, hence prepending with `option:`.

This change ensures `encap:X,Y` is properly translated into either
`encap:X,Y` if Y is numerical, or `encap:X,option:Y` if Y is text.

From `man 8 dnsmasq`:

```
-O, --dhcp-option=[tag:<tag>,[tag:<tag>,]][encap:<opt>,]
    [vi-encap:<enterprise>,][vendor:[<vendor-class>],]
    [<opt>|option:<opt-name>|option6:<opt>|option6:<opt-name>],
    [<value>[,<value>]]
...
    Options may be encapsulated (IPv4 only) within other options: for
    instance --dhcp-option=encap:175,190,iscsi-client0 will send option
    175, within which is the option 190. If multiple options are given
    which are encapsulated with the same option number then they will be
    correctly combined into one encapsulated option. encap: and vendor:
    are may not both be set in the same --dhcp-option.
...
```

One could argue the code ought to be improved to handle `vi-encap` and
`vendor` options as well...

Change-Id: I40f4dc04dd46dddc728cc5432fb3c99049931141

commit_message:
Support encapsulated DHCP options

Some PXE implementations, including iPXE, use vendor-specific options
encapsulated in a single top-level option to send configuration data in
DHCP packets. As an example, iPXE encapsulates various options in option
175.

This is fully supported by dnsmasq (see below), however, the original
code which translates a DHCP option name and value into a dnsmasq
command-line argument would expect any non-numeric option 'name' to be a
named option, hence prepending with `option:`.

This change ensures `encap:X,Y` is properly translated into either
`encap:X,Y` if Y is numerical, or `encap:X,option:Y` if Y is text.

From `man 8 dnsmasq`:

```
-O, --dhcp-option=[tag:<tag>,[tag:<tag>,]][encap:<opt>,]
    [vi-encap:<enterprise>,][vendor:[<vendor-class>],]
    [<opt>|option:<opt-name>|option6:<opt>|option6:<opt-name>],
    [<value>[,<value>]]
...
    Options may be encapsulated (IPv4 only) within other options: for
    instance --dhcp-option=encap:175,190,iscsi-client0 will send option
    175, within which is the option 190. If multiple options are given
    which are encapsulated with the same option number then they will be
    correctly combined into one encapsulated option. encap: and vendor:
    are may not both be set in the same --dhcp-option.
...
```

One could argue the code ought to be improved to handle `vi-encap` and
`vendor` options as well...

Closes-bug: #1860488
Change-Id: I40f4dc04dd46dddc728cc5432fb3c99049931141
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/neutron refs/changes/66/681466/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: @classmethod def _format_option(cls, ip_version, tag, option, *args): tag = cls._TAG_PREFIX % tag # honored if not in the format "option6:$NUM". else: pattern = r"(encap:(\d+),)?(.*)$" matches = re.match(pattern, option) encap = matches.groups()[0] option = matches.groups()[2] if not option.isdigit(): option = 'option:%s' % option if encap: option = '%s,%s' % (encap[:-1], option)
deleted_lines: def _format_option(self, ip_version, tag, option, *args): tag = self._TAG_PREFIX % tag # honored if not in the format "option6:$NUM". For IPv4 we # only apply if the option is non-numeric. elif not option.isdigit(): option = 'option:%s' % option

commit_message:
Change ResourceAllocator tests to not use /tmp

/tmp should not be hard-coded in test paths, instead
use get_temp_file_path() to create test-specific
directories that will be automatically cleaned-up.

Change-Id: Ida45d82a000e8126ba40ab6be57dae57d6311297

commit_message:
(PoC)Classification field in Neutron DSCP

This patch is a PoC to demonstrate integration of
Neutron Classifier into Neutron QoS.
Includes, duplication of Rules so long as classifications
group ids don't overlap.

Change-Id: I03133e2213aae07d1e5a47ee845595dad43b638e

commit_message:
Introduction of Neutron Classifier

This patch migrates the neutron classifier service plugin into neutron's
core repo.
Also adds a mixin for the AgentExtensionsAPI to allow extensions to
retrieve the dictionary of a classification group.

- added a temporary file to store exceptions locally in Neutron for gate.

Depends-on: https://review.opendev.org/#/c/670049/
Change-Id: Ifb2610ca08c9e5012e08e2c86bbe3f29d4263e63

added_lines: # Copyright 2019 Intel Corporation. # # Licensed under the Apache License, Version 2.0 (the "License"); you may # not use this file except in compliance with the License. You may obtain # a copy of the License at # # http://www.apache.org/licenses/LICENSE-2.0 # # Unless required by applicable law or agreed to in writing, software # distributed under the License is distributed on an "AS IS" BASIS, WITHOUT # WARRANTIES OR CONDITIONS OF ANY KIND, either express or implied. See the # License for the specific language governing permissions and limitations # under the License. import abc import six from oslo_versionedobjects import base as obj_base from oslo_versionedobjects import fields as obj_fields from neutron.db.classification import models from neutron.objects import base from neutron.objects import common_types from neutron.objects import rbac_db from neutron_lib.db import api as db_api @obj_base.VersionedObjectRegistry.register class ClassificationGroup(rbac_db.NeutronRbacObject): # Version 1.0: Initial version VERSION = '1.0' # required by RbacNeutronMetaclass rbac_db_cls = models.ClassificationGroupRBAC db_model = models.ClassificationGroup fields = { 'id': common_types.UUIDField(), 'name': obj_fields.StringField(), 'description': obj_fields.StringField(), 'project_id': obj_fields.StringField(), 'shared': obj_fields.BooleanField(default=False), 'operator': obj_fields.EnumField(['AND', 'OR'], default='AND'), } fields_no_update = ['id', 'project_id'] @classmethod def get_object(cls, context, **kwargs): # We want to get the policy regardless of its tenant id. We'll make # sure the tenant has permission to access the policy later on. admin_context = context.elevated() with db_api.autonested_transaction(admin_context.session): obj = super(ClassificationGroup, cls).get_object(admin_context, **kwargs) if not obj or not cls.is_accessible(context, obj): return return obj @classmethod def get_bound_tenant_ids(cls, context, **kwargs): # If we can return the policy regardless of tenant, we don't need # to return the tenant id. pass @obj_base.VersionedObjectRegistry.register class CGToClassificationMapping(base.NeutronDbObject): VERSION = '1.0' rbac_db_model = models.ClassificationGroupRBAC db_model = models.CGToClassificationMapping fields = { 'container_cg_id': common_types.UUIDField(), 'stored_classification_id': common_types.UUIDField()} @obj_base.VersionedObjectRegistry.register class CGToClassificationGroupMapping(base.NeutronDbObject): VERSION = '1.0' rbac_db_model = models.ClassificationGroupRBAC db_model = models.CGToClassificationGroupMapping fields = { 'container_cg_id': common_types.UUIDField(), 'stored_cg_id': common_types.UUIDField() } @six.add_metaclass(abc.ABCMeta) class ClassificationBase(base.NeutronDbObject): VERSION = '1.0' db_model = models.ClassificationBase fields = { 'id': common_types.UUIDField(), 'name': obj_fields.StringField(), 'description': obj_fields.StringField(), 'project_id': obj_fields.StringField(), 'shared': obj_fields.BooleanField(default=False), 'c_type': obj_fields.StringField(), 'negated': obj_fields.BooleanField(default=False), } fields_no_update = ['id', 'c_type'] @classmethod def get_objects(cls, context, _pager=None, validate_filters=True, **kwargs): with db_api.autonested_transaction(context.session): objects = super(ClassificationBase, cls).get_objects(context, _pager, validate_filters, **kwargs) return objects @obj_base.VersionedObjectRegistry.register class IPV4Classification(ClassificationBase): VERSION = '1.0' db_model = models.IPV4Classification fields = { 'dscp': obj_fields.IntegerField(nullable=True), 'dscp_mask': obj_fields.IntegerField(nullable=True), 'ecn': obj_fields.EnumField(valid_values=["0", "1", "2", "3"], nullable=True), 'length_min': obj_fields.IntegerField(nullable=True), 'length_max': obj_fields.IntegerField(nullable=True), 'flags': obj_fields.IntegerField(nullable=True), 'flags_mask': obj_fields.IntegerField(nullable=True), 'ttl_min': obj_fields.IntegerField(nullable=True), 'ttl_max': obj_fields.IntegerField(nullable=True), 'protocol': obj_fields.IntegerField(nullable=True), 'src_addr': obj_fields.StringField(nullable=True), 'dst_addr': subject: [DNM] Enable OVN RBAC by default
revisions:

commit_message:
[DNM] Enable OVN RBAC by default

__NOTE__ We can currently not enable this in the gate as there
appear to be a couple of optimizations added to the Neutron
OVN mech driver that writes to the OVN Southbound database.

As soon as these have been replaced by fixes in OVN itself we
can remove the writes to the OVN Southbound database from
Neutron and enable RBAC in the gate test.

Change-Id: I69d466226875bbd1ab43eb29de91f7fc1bb9dbce
Related-Bug: #1864640
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/neutron refs/changes/58/710558/5 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: if is_service_enabled ovn-rbac; then OVN_RBAC="role ovn-controller" fi# # NOTE: When OVN RBAC is enabled the UUID will not be used as identification. # NOTE: When OVN RBAC is enabled a UUID will not be used as identification. if [ -z "$OVN_RBAC" -a -z "$OVN_UUID" ] ; then ovs-vsctl --no-wait set open_vswitch . external-ids:system-id="${OVN_UUID:-$DEVSTACK_HOSTNAME}" ovn-sbctl --db=unix:$OVS_RUNDIR/ovnsb_db.sock set-connection p${OVN_PROTO}:6642:$SERVICE_LISTEN_ADDRESS -- set connection . inactivity_probe=60000 ${OVN_RBAC:-}
deleted_lines: if [ -z "$OVN_UUID" ] ; then ovs-vsctl --no-wait set open_vswitch . external-ids:system-id="$OVN_UUID" ovn-sbctl --db=unix:$OVS_RUNDIR/ovnsb_db.sock set-connection p${OVN_PROTO}:6642:$SERVICE_LISTEN_ADDRESS -- set connection . inactivity_probe=60000

commit_message:
[WIP] Remove ofctl from firewall driver

Work to be completed:
rules.py needs to be changed to use native, partiatially migrated.
firewall.py has issues with flows using ct_mark and ct_state.
Update tests.

Change-Id: I531caeaf521344c3f56210bcf8f5cbf403680410
Related-Bug: #1853171

subject: [WIP] Block non-standard ethertypes by default
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2019-07-10 22:06:56.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/neutron/commit/3429d7b4105a8e2e186f6ca53359b77232e8437d', 'message': "[WIP] Block non-standard ethertypes by default

This change adds a new capability that works with the iptables_hybrid
firewall to control ethertypes.  The standard ethertypes corresponding
to IPv4, IPv6, and ARP are permitted, as are ethertypes that are
permitted by configuration option.  All other ethertypes are blocked by
default.

This feature will be controlled by a boolean configuration option that
will default to 'false' so that an operator upgrading a cloud without
prior knowledge of this feature will not suddenly find their cloud
applications that make use of custom ethertypes to be broken.  The use
of this feature is highly suggested but not without testing and
validation.

This is a work in progress.  Pending to-do items include but are not
limited to:

- Add the configuration option to enable/disable this feature
- Functional tests
- Release note
- Make sure that this does not interfere with the arp spoofing
protection implementation in the linuxbridge mech driver

Spec for this feature: https://review.opendev.org/#/c/668242/

Change-Id: Icdf083ee279102d30ccb7b19e5299dd1cc743d72
Resolves-Bug: #1832758

"}, {'number': 11, 'created': '2019-07-30 21:42:04.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/neutron/commit/890d19db2f7fb02a8b477491078b81d337ad7192', 'message': "[WIP] Block non-standard ethertypes by default

This change adds a new capability that works with the iptables_hybrid
firewall to control ethertypes.  The standard ethertypes corresponding
to IPv4, IPv6, and ARP are permitted, as are ethertypes that are
permitted by configuration option.  All other ethertypes are blocked by
default.

This feature will be controlled by a boolean configuration option that
will default to 'false' so that an operator upgrading a cloud without
prior knowledge of this feature will not suddenly find their cloud
applications that make use of custom ethertypes to be broken.  The use
of this feature is highly suggested but not without testing and
validation.

This is a work in progress.  Pending to-do items include but are not
limited to:

- Make sure that this does not interfere with the arp spoofing
protection implementation in the linuxbridge mech driver
- Ensure that the implementation for OVS firewall is also configured
properly when using this facility.

commit_message:
[WIP] Block non-standard ethertypes by default

This change adds a new capability that works with the iptables_hybrid
firewall to control ethertypes.  The standard ethertypes corresponding
to IPv4, IPv6, and ARP are permitted, as are ethertypes that are
permitted by configuration option.  All other ethertypes are blocked by
default.

This feature will be controlled by a boolean configuration option that
will default to 'false' so that an operator upgrading a cloud without
prior knowledge of this feature will not suddenly find their cloud
applications that make use of custom ethertypes to be broken.  The use
of this feature is highly suggested but not without testing and
validation.

This is a work in progress.  Pending to-do items include but are not
limited to:

- Make sure that this does not interfere with the arp spoofing
protection implementation in the linuxbridge mech driver
- Ensure that the implementation for OVS firewall is also configured
properly when using this facility.

Spec for this feature: https://review.opendev.org/#/c/668242/

Co-Authored-By: Slawek Kaplonski <skaplons@redhat.com>

Depends-On: https://review.opendev.org/673692
Change-Id: Icdf083ee279102d30ccb7b19e5299dd1cc743d72
Resolves-Bug: #1838473

'filter' self.filter = ethertype_filter.EthertypeFilter() def test_add_ethertype_permit_ethertype_valid(self): etype = '0x4008' expected = [ mock.call(['ebtables', '-t', self.table, '--concurrent', self.execute.assert_has_calls(expected)

subject: Fix unnecessary network flap when update FIP
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2020-03-12 10:31:21.000000000', 'files': ['neutron/plugins/ml2/drivers/ovn/mech_driver/ovsdb/ovn_client.py'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/neutron/commit/c48f96cd7fdd6f37daf29c5e5b182e91603ca310', 'message': "Fix unnecessary network flap when update FIP

While updating FIP without port or fixed ip changed.
For example, updating its description via neutron API,
or associate same floatingip and fixed ip more than once,
it will delete the old one ,than add a new one[0].
Then,it will make network flap.

Because we don't change FIP or fixed ip , so there is no
need to update NBDB table, and the network flap should be avoided.

[0]https://github.com/openstack/neutron/blob/master/neutron/plugins/ml2/drivers/ovn/mech_driver/ovsdb/ovn_client.py#L1089

Change-Id: I96cf48856df738dbe35854e42162a1ebc65af105
Related-Bug: #1867122
"}]
commit_message:
Fix unnecessary network flap when update FIP

While updating FIP without port or fixed ip changed.
For example, updating its description via neutron API,
or associate same floatingip and fixed ip more than once,
it will delete the old one ,than add a new one[0].
Then,it will make network flap.

Because we don't change FIP or fixed ip , so there is no
need to update NBDB table, and the network flap should be avoided.

[0]https://github.com/openstack/neutron/blob/master/neutron/plugins/ml2/drivers/ovn/mech_driver/ovsdb/ovn_client.py#L1089

Change-Id: I96cf48856df738dbe35854e42162a1ebc65af105
Related-Bug: #1867122

commit_message:
Convert pref to priority for canonicalization.

In IP rule the pref and priority are interchangeable.When using
pref as input, the returned result is priority, which is not
standard, so need to convert pref to priority every time.

Change-Id: I1f0ce9ae8895836b37d66e6cbf2eeb71277f60fe
Closes-Bug: #1869139

commit_message:
If a network is updated with an MTU too large reject it

We reject MTU values greater than global_physnet_mtu on network create,
we should do the same on network update.

Change-Id: I5eb9596348d5525c3983b76530cd4f252fa95e41
Resolves-bug: 1867214

commit_message:
[WIP] Add segments info to neutron network context

If segments is available, we should add this information
to the neutron context, instead hiding it somewhere.

This would help us skip some unnecessary db fetches.

Depends-On: https://review.opendev.org/#/c/716275

Related-Bug: 1869877

Change-Id: I289e22ef68c381e9c457b45ea1f45ab219940a79

commit_message:
[DNR] Check new engine facade effectiveness

Try enabling the new engine facade in the neutron objects base class to
see if things work well or if there is massive breakage.  When I tested
locally, it was the latter, and I want to have that documented before
talking about it in the PTG.

Change-Id: Ie0ff87732847ea060ee457afba51cfe6ba54088f

subject: Avoid Layer 2 and Layer 3 traffic flooding in DVR mode.
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2020-03-27 13:07:05.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/neutron/commit/0d751e12d9ff6472276f28ffb0ed41e7283f743f', 'message': 'Avoid Layer 2 and Layer 3 traffic flooding in DVR mode.

This patch add a new flow table AVOID_FLOOD_TABLE(59) which
process the packets with src_mac is gateway_mac. In order to
avoid l2 flooding, move the original flows to local port in
table 60 to the table 59 and add the gateway_mac in the match.
So the egress and ingress traffic of l2 traffic will always
use the NORMAL flow in table 60 and the mac address of remote
ports will be learned.

For the l3 traffic, this patch add flow in table 0 which
resubmit the packets from router interface to table 59. There
are two kinds of flows in table 59. One is to process the
packets which from the local router to local ports. The other
is a low priority flow to process the packets which sent from
local router to remote ports and the packets sent to patch_tun_port,
so the egress traffic will be directed to the patch_tun_port
and will not to be flood.

Change-Id: I257cc4966379ddacbcaa6fbe8552e638cda303f3
Closes-bug: #1866445

commit_message:
Avoid Layer 2 and Layer 3 traffic flooding in DVR mode.

This patch add a new flow table AVOID_FLOOD_TABLE(59) which
process the packets with src_mac is gateway_mac. In order to
avoid l2 flooding, move the original flows to local port in
table 60 to the table 59 and add the gateway_mac in the match.
So the egress and ingress traffic of l2 traffic will always
use the NORMAL flow in table 60 and the mac address of remote
ports will be learned.

For the l3 traffic, this patch add flow in table 0 which
resubmit the packets from router interface to table 59. There
are two kinds of flows in table 59. One is to process the
packets which from the local router to local ports. The other
is a low priority flow to process the packets which sent from
local router to remote ports and the packets sent to patch_tun_port,
so the egress traffic will be directed to the patch_tun_port
and will not to be flood.

Change-Id: I257cc4966379ddacbcaa6fbe8552e638cda303f3
Closes-bug: #1866445

commit_message:
For trunk parent ports set device_id to trunk id

Set the subport device_id to trunk_id to prevent nova and
neutron from reusing it.

commit_message:
WIP: Sync enhancement for big data sets

Current code adds all commands to a single transaction for commit.
Sometimes, this will not work if the number of commands are big (>1000).

As these commands are independent, there is no need to do them in one
transaction. Allow the ability to split this up into multiple transactions so a
big sync might be able to progress incrementally.

Partial-Bug: #1871272
Change-Id: Ie73cfbd6616f79f0b1f3e5e9e1fae3d3a4784ae8

commit_message:
WIP: Replace depreacted filter:healthcheck by app:healthcheck

After applying the same patch on other OpenStack services, it
appears that healthcheck should be an app, not a filter.

This patch:
- Switches to an app, instead of a filter.
- Add the disable_by_file_path plugin.
- Add a functional test to make sure all of this is always working.

Change-Id: I7e4cd88281fb573ca7f91068f1645a474c6be7c3

Catch all exceptions during get_device_details would likely cause problems when agent is starting up, because agent is going to clean stale flows eventually.

Ideally cleaning should also depend on values from failed devices but rather than sort out different situations, it might be beneficially to simply failed the sync when MQ is running abnormally.

Change-Id: I780a7d5f9a9c2e23ff421ecaebe6dbfbefc4450a
'}, {'number': 2, 'created': '2020-05-11 13:28:37.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/neutron/commit/3c9e1b0338b512cb1c25e99242a00b23492d3474', 'message': 'Reraise timeout exception

Catch all exceptions in get_device_details would likely
cause problems when agent is starting up. For example,
imagine there are many ports hosted by one ovs-agent, and
unfortunately rabbitmq is working abnormally where consecutive
calls of get_device_detail could fail ocassionaly which means
only partial information is retrieved by agent, and those devices
which do not get fetched will be classed as failed and eventually
they are cleared in flow because they are stale.

We shuould be more careful on clear stable flows by either by
sorting out different scenarios and figure out coresponding actions.
But for me, maybe it is more consistent by simply raising timeout
exception just like other api did.

commit_message:
Reraise timeout exception

Catch all exceptions in get_device_details would likely
cause problems when agent is starting up. For example,
imagine there are many ports hosted by one ovs-agent, and
unfortunately rabbitmq is working abnormally where consecutive
calls of get_device_detail could fail ocassionaly which means
only partial information is retrieved by agent, and those devices
which do not get fetched will be classed as failed and eventually
they are cleared in flow because they are stale.

We shuould be more careful on clear stable flows by either by
sorting out different scenarios and figure out coresponding actions.
But for me, maybe it is more consistent by simply raising timeout
exception just like other api did.

Change-Id: I780a7d5f9a9c2e23ff421ecaebe6dbfbefc4450a
Partial-Bug: #1877248
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/neutron refs/changes/92/726492/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: except oslo_messaging.MessagingTimeout: # raise timeout exception rather than catch them # this is added to avoid unexpectedly clean stable # flow when either MQ is working abnormally or server # is overloaded raise

commit_message:
[Fullstack] Refactor SG tests

As firewall driver in fullstack tests can interfere between various
tests, all tests were so far added to single test in the class.

It was hard e.g. to debug when exaclty specific issue happend.
So now, as those tests are always run serially (at least in the gate)
lets refactor it and make separate test cases for various scenarios.

Change-Id: I4b52ebed6ae6fe568a0d725e08fcdb2c819341f2

commit_message:
Ensure iptables rule was added only once

This patch adds a check for iptables_manager to ensure the rule
was added only once to the list. This will avoid some unexpected
behavior during rule removal procedure.

Change-Id: I352b0ff734682dfa8c3f95e938fd8455f720c674
Closes-Bug: #1845145

added_lines: def test_add_rule_once(self): self.iptables.ipv4['filter'].add_chain('filter') rule_len_before = len(self.iptables.ipv4['filter'].rules) self.iptables.ipv4['filter'].add_rule('filter', '-j DROP') self.iptables.ipv4['filter'].add_rule('INPUT', '-s 0/0 -d 192.168.0.2 -j' ' %(bn)s-filter' % IPTABLES_ARG, once=True) self.iptables.ipv4['filter'].add_rule('INPUT', '-s 0/0 -d 192.168.0.3 -j' ' %(bn)s-filter' % IPTABLES_ARG, once=True) self.iptables.ipv4['filter'].add_rule('INPUT', '-s 0/0 -d 192.168.0.4 -j' ' %(bn)s-filter' % IPTABLES_ARG, once=True) self.iptables.ipv4['filter'].add_rule('INPUT', '-s 0/0 -d 192.168.0.2 -j' ' %(bn)s-filter' % IPTABLES_ARG, once=True) self.iptables.ipv4['filter'].add_rule('INPUT', '-s 0/0 -d 192.168.0.3 -j' ' %(bn)s-filter' % IPTABLES_ARG, once=True) self.iptables.ipv4['filter'].add_rule('INPUT', '-s 0/0 -d 192.168.0.4 -j' ' %(bn)s-filter' % IPTABLES_ARG, once=True) self.iptables.ipv4['filter'].add_rule('INPUT', '-s 0/0 -d 192.168.0.5 -j' ' %(bn)s-filter' % IPTABLES_ARG, once=True) self.iptables.ipv4['filter'].add_rule('INPUT', '-s 0/0 -d 192.168.0.5 -j' ' %(bn)s-filter' % IPTABLES_ARG, once=True) self.iptables.apply() # Only 5 new rules, and 192.168.0.2/3/4/5 each one has a duplication. self.assertEqual(rule_len_before + 5, len(self.iptables.ipv4['filter'].rules))

commit_message:
Enable test_ping_global_ip_from_vm_with_fip in tha gate

The test has been introduced recently to neutron-tempest-plugin [1] but is
disabled by default. This patch makes 8.8.8.8 serve as a public IP that
we try to ping to.

[1] https://review.opendev.org/#/c/727764/

Change-Id: I83226dffefd0451e0c27b1f65f3a8b217fde8d4c

commit_message:
Keep stale flows if there are failed devices

Under some circumstances, some devices may not be
successfully updated and added to failed device map.
Delay stable flow cleaning until failed devices are
gone.

Change-Id: Icef940c6a6619f988460d8544ad646a31fbf7195
Related-Bugs: #1877248

commit_message:
Temporarily disable timeouts for neutron-ovn-db-sync-util

The standard timeouts will almost certainly be hit when dealing
with a database of any significant size. Some timeouts are runtime
config opts, others are stored in the various OVS databases. This
patch will store the existing values, effectively disable the
timeouts, then restore the previous values.

This is a PoC to see if others like this kind of solution, or if
it should be relegated to some kind of deployment tool, so I'd
like some feedback. Thanks!

TODO:
Testing
Make configurable?
Group into transactions for NB/SB DB ops

Change-Id: I53b4113ba90be6a7f415d67ed38c962c1700c3bf

subject: [WIP] ovn: Implement stateless security groups support
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2020-06-10 17:33:55.000000000', 'files': ['neutron/plugins/ml2/drivers/ovn/mech_driver/ovsdb/ovn_client.py', 'neutron/tests/unit/plugins/ml2/drivers/ovn/mech_driver/test_mech_driver.py', 'neutron/plugins/ml2/drivers/ovn/mech_driver/ovsdb/ovn_db_sync.py', 'neutron/common/ovn/acl.py'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/neutron/commit/cf6ba69065d964d30a3a8ac29f4a3d708a15466b', 'message': "[WIP] ovn: Implement stateless security groups support

OVN uses 'allow' action for stateless ACLs. This patch makes to use
'allow' for stateless and 'allow-related' actions for stateful security
groups.

Limitation: There is currently an issue in core OVN that makes it not
possible to use statless ACL if a stateful ACL is present for port on
the same chassis.

NOTE: I don't know how to enable stateful-security-group API extension
so unittests are currently failing.

Blueprint: stateless-security-groups

commit_message:
[WIP] ovn: Implement stateless security groups support

OVN uses 'allow' action for stateless ACLs. This patch makes to use
'allow' for stateless and 'allow-related' actions for stateful security
groups.

Limitation: There is currently an issue in core OVN that makes it not
possible to use statless ACL if a stateful ACL is present for port on
the same chassis.

NOTE: I don't know how to enable stateful-security-group API extension
so unittests are currently failing.

Blueprint: stateless-security-groups

Change-Id: I6f8ad1461cb3059aeb606b936296b8113538896e
Signed-off-by: Jakub Libosvar <libosvar@redhat.com>

commit_message:
[WIP] Add native OVSDB implementation for polling monitor

TODO: remove prints and extra logs for debugging
      UTs/FTs
      remove useless code
      pep8 errors everywhere

This patch implements an OVS interface monitor based in the OVSDB
native implementation (OVSDB IDL, Open vSwitch Database Interface
Definition Language).

Change-Id: I733986ea8e6f8570ed5c774231b6f2b033c40115
Closes-Bug: #1789592

commit_message:
Remove IPv6 hotplug test from the OVN jobs' blacklist

Root cause of this issue was fixed in the OVN:
https://mail.openvswitch.org/pipermail/ovs-dev/2020-June/371635.html
so we should be good to run this test in our gate now.

Related-Bug: #1881558

commit_message:
Could not create subnet successful when gateway not in range of sunet cidr

When we create a subent, we need to provide the gateway address,
but if gateway not in range of subnet, we can still create subnet
successful, so this is not correct.

Fixes: bug #1884009
Change-Id: I8bb28f80614766b899860fb53020fc2d1f3956c6

commit_message:
[WIP] Fix the designate dns_name confilct for extra port

when the user try to add an extra port to already existing server
or create a server with multiple ports, designate will raise a
conflict exception in dns_name since it will be the same for the
two ports.

This also can solve the problem if the dns_name already exist
it will create another unique dns_name from the dns_name and
ip hash rather than failing to create a record

Change-Id: I1fb0cd0e1dc9466a50428b4a92b5dbbb97a524e0
Closes-Bug: #1879009

added_lines: rec_type = 'A' proj_id = context.project_id if v6: rec_type = 'AAAA' updated_ids = self._insert_records_under_dns_name(proj_id, dns_domain, dns_name, records, rec_type, designate) if not updated_ids: raise dns_exc.DuplicateRecordSet(dns_name=dns_name) try: ids_to_delete = self._get_ids_ips_to_delete( dns_domain, '%s.%s' % (dns_name, dns_domain), records, designate) except dns_exc.DuplicateRecordSet: self._do_partial_recordset_delete(dns_name, dns_domain, records) def _insert_records_under_dns_name(self, project_id, dns_domain, name, records, rec_type, designate_client): try: recordsets = designate_client.recordsets.list( dns_domain, criterion={"name": "%s" % name, "type"; "%s" % rec_type}) except d_exc.NotFound: raise dns_exc.DNSDomainNotFound(dns_domain=dns_domain) # it will be one record (two records with the same dns_name # and record type will be dns_conflict in designate) ids = [rec['id'] for rec in recordsets if \ rec['project_id'] == project_id] # empty nothing to do if not ids: return ids ips = [str(ip) for rec in recordsets for ip in rec['records']] ips.append(records) update = {"records" : ips} for rec_id in ids: designate_client.update(dns_domain, rec_id, update) return ids def _do_partial_recordset_delete(name, dns_domain, records) recordsets = designate_client.recordsets.list(dns_domain, criterion={"name": "%s" % name}) records_to_delete = set(records) for rec in recordsets: ips = {str(ip) for ip in rec['records']} ips_to_keep = ips.difference(records_to_delete) if ips != ips_to_keep: update = {'records': list(ips_to_keep)} designate_client.update(dns_domain, rec_id, update)

commit_message:
Ensure iptables rule was added only once

This patch adds a check for iptables_manager to ensure the rule
was added only once to the list. This will avoid some unexpected
behavior during rule removal procedure.

Change-Id: I352b0ff734682dfa8c3f95e938fd8455f720c674
Closes-Bug: #1845145
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/neutron refs/changes/25/730825/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: def test_add_rule_once(self): self.iptables.ipv4['filter'].add_chain('filter') rule_len_before = len(self.iptables.ipv4['filter'].rules) self.iptables.ipv4['filter'].add_rule('filter', '-j DROP') self.iptables.ipv4['filter'].add_rule('INPUT', '-s 0/0 -d 192.168.0.2 -j' ' %(bn)s-filter' % IPTABLES_ARG, once=True) self.iptables.ipv4['filter'].add_rule('INPUT', '-s 0/0 -d 192.168.0.3 -j' ' %(bn)s-filter' % IPTABLES_ARG, once=True) self.iptables.ipv4['filter'].add_rule('INPUT', '-s 0/0 -d 192.168.0.4 -j' ' %(bn)s-filter' % IPTABLES_ARG, once=True) self.iptables.ipv4['filter'].add_rule('INPUT', '-s 0/0 -d 192.168.0.2 -j' ' %(bn)s-filter' % IPTABLES_ARG, once=True) self.iptables.ipv4['filter'].add_rule('INPUT', '-s 0/0 -d 192.168.0.3 -j' ' %(bn)s-filter' % IPTABLES_ARG, once=True) self.iptables.ipv4['filter'].add_rule('INPUT', '-s 0/0 -d 192.168.0.4 -j' ' %(bn)s-filter' % IPTABLES_ARG, once=True) self.iptables.ipv4['filter'].add_rule('INPUT', '-s 0/0 -d 192.168.0.5 -j' ' %(bn)s-filter' % IPTABLES_ARG, once=True) self.iptables.ipv4['filter'].add_rule('INPUT', '-s 0/0 -d 192.168.0.5 -j' ' %(bn)s-filter' % IPTABLES_ARG, once=True) self.iptables.apply() # Only 5 new rules, and 192.168.0.2/3/4/5 each one has a duplication. self.assertEqual(rule_len_before + 5, len(self.iptables.ipv4['filter'].rules))

commit_message:
solve ingress packets causes flooding on integration bridge for vlan network

There is no need to add egress direct flows for vlan ports. For those ports,
traffic will still match the original NORMAL flow.

Change-Id: I90e447340945e99c92d72194397d068091bcbe73
Closes-Bug: #1884708
Related-Bug: #1732067
Related-Bug: #1866445
