added_lines: # NOTE(uchenily) we shouldn't install egress flows for vlan ports. For # details please check https://bugs.launchpad.net/neutron/+bug/1884708 non_vlan_ports = ( port for port in need_binding_devices if self.vlan_manager.get(port['network_id']). network_type != n_const.TYPE_VLAN) self.process_install_ports_egress_flows(non_vlan_ports)

subject: quota: use native oslo.db retry
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2020-07-14 14:32:49.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/neutron/commit/9d9d399793f76e73d11d3759c38068bee46ad4aa', 'message': "quota: use native oslo.db retry

There are some issues with setting quota usages to dirty which cause
deadlocks that have been worked around by adding the global retry hook,
this has actually caused more issues in our larger scale deployments and
ended up giving retries without proper stacktraces and missing
savepoints.

All OpenStack projects adopt native use of oslo_db retry function
natively, the reason for the use of the current Neutron model is to
avoid nested retries, which really is a workaround rather than solving
the fundamental issue of clearing out the queries that deadlock.

This patch removes any retries from SELECT operations, as those will
likely not really be affected much (and don't need to be retried).  We
will be retrying the UPDATE operation anyways (if it's deadlocked on
that).

All of the update operations have been updated to use the oslo_db retry
decorator, we can probably drop some of those eventually (even a project
like Nova has very little of those (in ~250-ish database API functions,
only 13 are actually tagged to retry on deadlock).

It also removes the API-level retry for all operations, as it's much
better to hit and narrow down on the deadlock-able operations.  This
should eventually be moved onto all other components but for now, this
patch covers quota as it's a hard hit (plugging 250 ports concurrently
results in 504s and deadlocks everywhere).

Change-Id: Ibd3343fc74a9a78f3ec974c204a5bbf5310758b7
Related-Bug: #1777965
Related-Bug: #1771293
Related-Bug: #1887523

commit_message:
quota: use native oslo.db retry

There are some issues with setting quota usages to dirty which cause
deadlocks that have been worked around by adding the global retry hook,
this has actually caused more issues in our larger scale deployments and
ended up giving retries without proper stacktraces and missing
savepoints.

All OpenStack projects adopt native use of oslo_db retry function
natively, the reason for the use of the current Neutron model is to
avoid nested retries, which really is a workaround rather than solving
the fundamental issue of clearing out the queries that deadlock.

This patch removes any retries from SELECT operations, as those will
likely not really be affected much (and don't need to be retried).  We
will be retrying the UPDATE operation anyways (if it's deadlocked on
that).

All of the update operations have been updated to use the oslo_db retry
decorator, we can probably drop some of those eventually (even a project
like Nova has very little of those (in ~250-ish database API functions,
only 13 are actually tagged to retry on deadlock).

It also removes the API-level retry for all operations, as it's much
better to hit and narrow down on the deadlock-able operations.  This
should eventually be moved onto all other components but for now, this
patch covers quota as it's a hard hit (plugging 250 ports concurrently
results in 504s and deadlocks everywhere).

This patch also makes some changes to the quota driver to avoid having
calls for retries there as they are handled at a much lower level inside
the quota database API.

Change-Id: Ibd3343fc74a9a78f3ec974c204a5bbf5310758b7
Related-Bug: #1777965
Related-Bug: #1771293
Related-Bug: #1887523

commit_message:
[RFC] OVN: Add tool for offline migration of network type

__NOTE__: The purpose of this patch set is to gather initial
comments and feedback on the approach taken to solve the
described problem. Please refer to docstring in the added module
for more details.

The script needs to be updated to use common Neutron OVO existing
infrastructure for segment allocation, logging, configuration
parser etc. before it can be reviewed for possible inclusion in
the project.

I'd be happy to do that work if the gathered feedback points in a
direction of that being welcome, and any pointers for where to
enter the above described Neutron resources to do it properly
would also be welcome.

Change-Id: I2f7a9de24f079664892605a4de55666035537da3
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/neutron refs/changes/32/743832/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines:
#!/usr/bin/env python3 # Copyright 2020 Canonical Ltd # # Licensed under the Apache License, Version 2.0 (the "License"); # you may not use this file except in compliance with the License. # You may obtain a copy of the License at # # http://www.apache.org/licenses/LICENSE-2.0 # # Unless required by applicable law or agreed to in writing, software # distributed under the License is distributed on an "AS IS" BASIS, # WITHOUT WARRANTIES OR CONDITIONS OF ANY KIND, either express or implied. # See the License for the specific language governing permissions and # limitations under the License. """migration_offline_network_type_update The purpose of this module is to provide a tool that allow the user to perform Neutron database surgery to change the type of tunnel networks from 'gre' and 'vxlan' to 'geneve'. It is an optional part of a migration from a legacy Neutron ML2+OVS to ML2+OVN deployment. At the time of this writing the Neutron OVN ML2 driver will assume that all chassis participating in a network to use the 'geneve' tunnel protocol and it will ignore the value of the `network_type` field in any non-physical network in the Neutron database. It will also ignore the `segmentation_id` field and let OVN assign the VNIs [0]. The Neutron API currently does not support changing the type of a network, so when doing a migration the above described behaviour is actually a welcome one. However, after the migration is done and all the primary functions are working, i.e. packets are forwarded. The end user of the cloud will be left with the false impression of their existing 'gre' or 'vxlan' typed networks still being operational on said tunnel protocols, while in reality 'geneve' is used under the hood. The end user will also run into issues with modifying any existing networks with `openstack network set` throwing error messages about networks of type 'gre' or 'vxlan' not being supported. After running this script said networks will have their `network_type` field changed to 'geneve' which will fix the above described problems. NOTE: Use this script with caution, it is of absolute importance that the `neutron-server` process is stopped while the script is running. 0: https://github.com/ovn-org/ovn/blob/1e07781310d8155997672bdce01a2ff4f5a93e83/northd/ovn-northd.c#L1188-L1268 """ # noqa import os import sys from oslo_db.sqlalchemy import session import sqlalchemy class NotFound(Exception): pass def main(argv): """Main function. :param argv: Argument list :type argv: List[str] :returns: POSIX exit code :rtype: int """ program = os.path.basename(argv[0]) if len(argv) < 2: usage(program) return os.EX_USAGE elif len(argv) < 3 or argv[2] != 'morph': print('DRY-RUN, WILL NOT COMMIT TRANSACTION') db_engine = session.create_engine(argv[1]) db_maker = session.get_maker(db_engine, autocommit=False) db_session = db_maker(bind=db_engine) to_network_type = 'geneve' for network_type in ('gre', 'vxlan'): n_morphed = morph_networks(db_session, network_type, to_network_type) print('Morphed {} networks of type {} to {}.' .format(n_morphed, network_type, to_network_type)) if len(argv) < 3 or argv[2] != 'morph': print('DRY-RUN, WILL NOT COMMIT TRANSACTION') return os.EX_USAGE db_session.commit() db_session.close() db_engine.dispose() return os.EX_OK def usage(program): """Print information about how to use program. :param program: Name of program :type program: str """ print('usage {} db-connection-string [morph]
' '
' 'Morph non-physical networks of type "gre" and "vxlan" into ' 'geneve networks.
' '
' 'The Neutron database must already have enough free "geneve" VNIs
' 'before running this tool. If the process stops because there are
' 'no more VNIs, increase the VNI range with the `vni_ranges`
' 'configuration option on the `ml2_type_geneve` section and then
' 'start and stop the neutron-server before trying again.
' '
' 'The second argument must be the literal string "morph" for the
' 'tool to perform an action, otherwise it will not commit the
' 'transaction to the database, effectively performing a dry run.
' ''.format(program), file=sys.stderr) def allocate_segment(db_session, network_type): """Allocate VNI for network_type. :param db_session: SQLAlchemy DB Session object. :type db_session: SQLAlchemy DB Session object. :param network_type: Network type to allocate vni for. :type network_type: str :returns: Allocated VNI :rtype: int """ alloc_table = 'ml2_{}_allocations'.format(network_type) vni_row = '{}_vni'.format(network_type) # Get next available VNI vni = None stmt = sqlalchemy.text( 'SELECT MIN({}) FROM {} WHERE allocated=0' .format(vni_row, alloc_table)) rs = db_session.execute(stmt) for row in rs: vni = next(row.itervalues()) # A aggregated query will always provide a result, check for NULL if vni is None: raise NotFound( 'unable to allocate "{}" segment.'.format(network_type)) break # Allocate VNI stmt = sqlalchemy.text( 'UPDATE {} SET allocated=1 WHERE {}=:vni'.format(alloc_table, vni_row)) db_session.execute(stmt, {'vni': vni}) return vni def deallocate_segment(db_session, network_type, vni): """Deallocate VNI for network_type. :param db_session: SQLAlchemy DB Session object. :type db_session: SQLAlchemy DB Session object. :param network_type: Network type to de-allocate vni for. :type network_type: str :param vni: VNI :type vni: int """ alloc_table = 'ml2_{}_allocations'.format(network_type) vni_row = '{}_vni'.format(network_type) # De-allocate VNI stmt = sqlalchemy.text( 'UPDATE {} SET allocated=0 WHERE {}=:vni'.format(alloc_table, vni_row)) db_session.execute(stmt, {'vni': vni}) def get_network_segments(db_session, network_type): """Get tunnel networks of certain type. :param db_session: SQLAlchemy DB Session object. :type db_session: SQLAlchemy DB Session object. :param network_type: Network type to iterate over. :type network_type: str :returns: Iterator for data :rtype: Iterator[str,str,str,int] """ # Get networks stmt = sqlalchemy.text( 'SELECT id,network_id,network_type,segmentation_id ' 'FROM networksegments ' 'WHERE physical_network IS NULL AND ' ' network_type=:network_type') rs = db_session.execute(stmt, {'network_type': network_type}) for row in rs: yield row.values() def morph_networks(db_session, from_network_type, to_network_type): """Morph all networks of one network type to another. :param db_session: SQLAlchemy DB Session object. :type db_session: SQLAlchemy DB Session object. :param from_network_type: Network type to morph from. :type from_network_type: str :param to_network_type: Network type to morph to. :type to_network_type: str :returns: Number of networks morphed :rtype: int """ stmt = sqlalchemy.text( 'UPDATE networksegments ' 'SET network_type=:new_network_type,segmentation_id=:new_vni ' 'WHERE id=:id') n_morphed = 0 for segment_id, network_id, network_type, vni in get_network_segments( db_session, from_network_type): new_vni = allocate_segment(db_session, to_network_type) db_session.execute(stmt, { 'new_network_type': to_network_type, 'new_vni': new_vni, 'id': segment_id, }) print('segment {} for network {} changed from {}:{} to {}:{}' .format(segment_id, network_id, network_type, vni, to_network_type, new_vni)) deallocate_segment(db_session, from_network_type, vni) n_morphed += 1 return n_morphed if __name__ == '__main__': sys.exit(main(sys.argv))

[OVN] Move neutron-ovn-tempest-full-multinode-ovs-master to periodic

Move the neutron-ovn-tempest-full-multinode-ovs-master to periodic
queue and in it place define
neutron-ovn-tempest-full-multinode-ovs-release job.

commit_message:
Switch to uwsgi in grenade jobs

As we want to switch Neutron's default deployment method in Devstack
to be uwsgi, we need also to switch it in grenade jobs for both old and
new version. Otherwise, grenade jobs are failing as they can't update
from non-wsgi to wsgi deployment.

Change-Id: Ia4c7f62c64635d5a35d665c343478393d77e9ef7

commit_message:
[DNM] Make an attempt at have the gate trip lock contention

It would be useful if the gate caught problems like the one
described in LP: #1890432. Let's see if we can make it happen by
adjusting rally config or if there are other environmental
differences.

Change-Id: I1eb4c4aa160431bc4910d136fd7c08c5961fa0a7

commit_message:
Make changes to have a changeable port network id

The neutron-lib change I7cd0f76cbfc27f44923bba7a57839f3a5364c5d1
adds an extension to have a changable port network id when the
port has no fixed-ip address on it.

Change-Id: I346bd9fb99fe38caf7e7d804c62e1687e98e9c21
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/neutron refs/changes/84/704884/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: from neutron_lib.api.definitions import port_net_id_writable subnetpool_prefix_ops_def.ALIAS, port_net_id_writable.ALIAS] if extensions.is_extension_supported(self, 'port-net-id-writable'): network = self.get_network(context, updated_port['network_id']) if updated_port['network_id'] != original_port['network_id']: if original_port.get('fixed_ips', None): raise exc.UpdatePortNetworkFixedIPError(port_id=id) if original_port['project_id'] and \ network['project_id'] != original_port['project_id']: raise exc.UpdatePortNetworkProjectIDError(port_id=id) else: network = self.get_network( context, original_port['network_id'])

commit_message:
Remove unformated prelude

In README.rst, **Avoid using "prelude" section** for individual
release notes. This patch removes the prelude in
'stateful-security-group-04b2902ed9c44e4f.yaml'.

Change-Id: I1b79e3afeac39b6a6d0f90b2b8cebed6eab14f50

deleted_lines: prelude: > Added support to create stateless security groups.

commit_message:
Do not review: temporary check

Package installation using 'apt' inside an instance spawned by
tempest test does not work when running on upstream gates.
This is temporary code for investigating this issue.

Change-Id: Ie26f98d6f3f134a85b31d49ed9255df690dbac11

added_lines: # All Rights Reserved. # # Licensed under the Apache License, Version 2.0 (the "License"); you may # not use this file except in compliance with the License. You may obtain # a copy of the License at # # http://www.apache.org/licenses/LICENSE-2.0 # # Unless required by applicable law or agreed to in writing, software # distributed under the License is distributed on an "AS IS" BASIS, WITHOUT # WARRANTIES OR CONDITIONS OF ANY KIND, either express or implied. See the # License for the specific language governing permissions and limitations # under the License. from oslo_log import log from tempest.lib import decorators from neutron_tempest_plugin.common import ssh from neutron_tempest_plugin import config from neutron_tempest_plugin.scenario import base CONF = config.CONF LOG = log.getLogger(__name__) class InternetConnectivityTest(base.BaseTempestTestCase): credentials = ['primary', 'admin'] @decorators.idempotent_id('48747fcd-c97a-4e6e-8ba8-0863829e7fbb') def test_internet_connectvivity(self): self.setup_network_and_server() self.client = ssh.Client(self.fip['floating_ip_address'], CONF.validation.image_ssh_user, pkey=self.keypair['private_key']) output = self.client.exec_command("ping -c 4 8.8.8.8") LOG.debug(output) output = self.client.exec_command("ping -c 4 google.com") LOG.debug(output) output = self.client.exec_command("cat /etc/resolv.conf") LOG.debug(output) output = self.client.exec_command( "tracepath google.com || echo tracepath not found") LOG.debug(output) output = self.client.exec_command( "[ -e /etc/apt/sources.list ] && grep ^dev /etc/apt/sources.list |" " head -1 | cut -d '/' -f 3 || echo 'No apt repos'") LOG.debug(output) output = self.client.exec_command( "[ -e /usr/bin/apt ] && sudo apt install keepalived -y || " "echo No apt available") LOG.debug(output)

subject: [train][goal] Define new neutron-tempest-ipv6-only job
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2019-10-01 20:50:22.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/neutron-tempest-plugin/commit/bb5949880ed07445095cb35eca4c806d89308585', 'message': "[train][goal] Define new neutron-tempest-ipv6-only job

As part of Train community goal 'Support IPv6-Only Deployments and Testing'[1],
we need to define the integration job which deploy services
on IPv6 and perform testing to make sure service listen and communicate
over IPv6 properly.

Current 'tempest-ipv6-only' IPv6 job (running on neutron gate) only cover neutron
and run only smoke+ipv6 tests present in Tempest. But neutron-tempest-plugin has
more coverage for IPv6 and its stadium projects tests.

This commit adds the new job 'neutron-tempest-ipv6-only' which can deploy neutron
and other required services on IPv6 and run all required tests for Neutron and
its stadium projects IPv6 related tests.

After this, we can remove the tempest-ipv6-only from neutron gate and use this new
job instead.

Story: #2005477
Task: #35908

[1] https://governance.openstack.org/tc/goals/train/ipv6-support-and-testing.html

commit_message:
[train][goal] Define new neutron-tempest-ipv6-only job

As part of Train community goal 'Support IPv6-Only Deployments and Testing'[1],
we need to define the integration job which deploy services
on IPv6 and perform testing to make sure service listen and communicate
over IPv6 properly.

Current 'tempest-ipv6-only' IPv6 job (running on neutron gate) only cover neutron
and run only smoke+ipv6 tests present in Tempest. But neutron-tempest-plugin has
more coverage for IPv6 and its stadium projects tests.

This commit adds the new job 'neutron-tempest-ipv6-only' which can deploy neutron
and other required services on IPv6 and run all required tests for Neutron and
its stadium projects IPv6 related tests.

After this, we can remove the tempest-ipv6-only from neutron gate and use this new
job instead.

Story: #2005477
Task: #35908

[1] https://governance.openstack.org/tc/goals/train/ipv6-support-and-testing.html

Change-Id: Ia757540fee60657a801d34a731b91f3a78c17e25
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/neutron-tempest-plugin refs/changes/43/686043/9 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: vars: &base_vars- job: name: neutron-tempest-ipv6-only parent: devstack-tempest-ipv6 description: | Neutron and its stadium projects tempest tests job for IPv6-only deployment roles: - zuul: openstack/devstack timeout: 10800 # enable all stadium projects required-projects: - openstack/neutron - openstack/neutron-tempest-plugin - openstack/tempest - openstack/networking-sfc - openstack/networking-bagpipe - openstack/networking-bgpvpn - openstack/neutron-dynamic-routing - openstack/os-ken - openstack/neutron-fwaas vars: <<: *base_vars # This job does not need to run all the tests. Smoke and IPv6 tests are enough # to test the Ipv6 deployment. tempest_test_regex: "\[.*\bsmoke|ipv6|test_network_v6\b.*\]" devstack_services: neutron-log: true devstack_local_conf: post-config: # NOTE(slaweq): We can get rid of this hardcoded absolute path when # devstack-tempest job will be switched to use lib/neutron instead of # lib/neutron-legacy /$NEUTRON_CORE_PLUGIN_CONF: AGENT: tunnel_types: gre,vxlan network_log: local_output_log_base: /tmp/test_log.log devstack_localrc: PHYSICAL_NETWORK: default DOWNLOAD_DEFAULT_IMAGES: false IMAGE_URLS: "http://download.cirros-cloud.net/0.3.4/cirros-0.3.4-i386-disk.img,https://cloud-images.ubuntu.com/releases/xenial/release/ubuntu-16.04-server-cloudimg-amd64-disk1.img" DEFAULT_IMAGE_NAME: cirros-0.3.4-i386-disk ADVANCED_IMAGE_NAME: ubuntu-16.04-server-cloudimg-amd64-disk1 ADVANCED_INSTANCE_TYPE: ds512M ADVANCED_INSTANCE_USER: ubuntu BUILD_TIMEOUT: 784 network_api_extensions_stadium: - flow_classifier - sfc - bgpvpn - bgpvpn-routes-control - bgp - bgp_dragent_scheduler - bgp_4byte_asn - fwaas_v2 devstack_localrc: NETWORK_API_EXTENSIONS: "{{ (network_api_extensions_common + network_api_extensions_stadium) | join(',') }}" irrelevant-files: *tempest-irrelevant-files - neutron-tempest-ipv6-only - neutron-tempest-ipv6-only

commit_message:
[WIP] Add cleanups for trunks

A new change in Neutron (see Needed-By) is tightening up how trunk ports
are tracked.  In order to avoid PortInUseAsTrunkParent errors in tests
that don't have cleanups for trunks, add them.

Change-Id: I6373d346f7b4a39f9fbe09c48b5a8e21ae8d08d6
Needed-By: https://review.opendev.org/717350

commit_message:
Optimize the way to define the api_extensions

Devstack now has a way to append the api_extensions to the
default extensiones defined in devstack side
- https://review.opendev.org/#/c/666508/

master devstack set the 'all' api extensions so master
job does not need to set the api extensions. 'all' means
here is every extensions will be considered as enabled.

stable branch devstack set default set of extensions for each
stable branch. Neutron stable jobs only needs to append
the additional api_extensions enabled in that stable
branch job.

Change-Id: I8912b1a123ac52c99b65b93884702e792fa7ea86

the outside world was introduced.  This test is skipped by default,
unless "global_ip_address" will be set. So this patch sets
global_ip_address to be "zuul_site_mirror_fqdn", which is an external

commit_message:
Ping external resource in the neutron tests

In patch [1] a new test, which tests connectivity from the VM to
the outside world was introduced.  This test is skipped by default,
unless "global_ip_address" will be set. So this patch sets
global_ip_address to be "zuul_site_mirror_fqdn", which is an external
host that should be reachable with great reliability.

[1] https://review.opendev.org/#/c/727764/

Depends-On: https://review.opendev.org/733952
Change-Id: I936fa45d0a5d102c80a72abe24c904917d67cd40

commit_message:
Change code to store and cleanup admin-created networks

The create_network() code always stores created networks
in cls.networks, which can lead to a failure deleting
them since they could have been created with the admin
client. For this reason, most callers using the admin
client add their own addCleanup() call.

Change callers to pass the admin client to create_network()
to properly store these networks in cls.networks so they
are cleaned automatically.

Removed cls.admin_networks from BaseNetworkTest class since
it is never used.

Change-Id: I9fdd666c91e38c115bc2f5ec17859711d869ba26

commit_message:
fix firewall group deletion occasionally failed in fwaas tests

Firewall group cannot be deleted when its status
is pending_update. Check whether the status of the
firewall group become to active or inactive before
deleting it.

Closes-Bug: #1889730
Change-Id: I3f0f2f7ef4e7bf616332f804f43501af08ac6acb
Signed-off-by: Ning Yao <yaoning@unitedstack.com>

subject: Improve QoS BW limit scenario tests
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2020-04-20 10:47:52.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/neutron-tempest-plugin/commit/722e6d1044fe3e704b310edf8ac99f70157ad68b', 'message': "Improve QoS BW limit scenario tests

This patch improves qos scenario tests in cases when QoS policy is
attached to Neutron port and Floating IP.

In case when QoS is attached to the port, it changes values of bw
limits set. Before this patch limits where set first with lowest values
and later updated to some higher ones. But as our test is only checking
if real bandwidth is lower then configured one, such test can't catch
any issues with e.g. bandwidth limit rule updates.
So this patch changes this to set first highest value and then update
it to lower one.

In case when QoS is attached to Floating IP, it adds update of bandwidth
limit rule and ensure that this rule is also updated properly and new
limit is set for the Floating IP.

Change-Id: I58eb8bd6cf12287d98ae0c82b5f5aef576bd6df4
"}, {'number': 2, 'created': '2020-04-20 13:01:28.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/neutron-tempest-plugin/commit/129afec15c60bd6b574831c53715d5a53f5ca1c4', 'message': "Improve QoS BW limit scenario tests

commit_message:
Improve QoS BW limit scenario tests

This patch improves qos scenario tests in cases when QoS policy is
attached to Neutron port and Floating IP.

In case when QoS is attached to the port, it changes values of bw
limits set. Before this patch limits where set first with lowest values
and later updated to some higher ones. But as our test is only checking
if real bandwidth is lower then configured one, such test can't catch
any issues with e.g. bandwidth limit rule updates.
So this patch changes this to set first highest value and then update
it to lower one.

In case when QoS is attached to Floating IP, it adds update of bandwidth
limit rule and ensure that this rule is also updated properly and new
limit is set for the Floating IP.

Change-Id: I58eb8bd6cf12287d98ae0c82b5f5aef576bd6df4
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/neutron-tempest-plugin refs/changes/35/721235/4 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: def test_qos_basic_and_update(self): This test covers basic setting of QoS policy for Floating IP as well as updating bandwidth limit in QoS policy and checking if new values are applied properly. policy_id, max_kbps=constants.LIMIT_KILO_BITS_PER_SECOND * 2, max_burst_kbps=constants.LIMIT_KILO_BYTES * 2, policy_id, max_kbps=constants.LIMIT_KILO_BITS_PER_SECOND * 2, max_burst_kbps=constants.LIMIT_KILO_BYTES * 2, policy_id)['bandwidth_limit_rules'] self.assertEqual(2, len(rules)) common_utils.wait_until_true( lambda: self._check_bw( ssh_client, self.fip['floating_ip_address'], port=self.NC_PORT, expected_bw=self.LIMIT_BYTES_SEC * 2), timeout=120, sleep=1) for rule in rules: self.os_admin.network_client.update_bandwidth_limit_rule( policy_id, rule['id'], max_kbps=constants.LIMIT_KILO_BITS_PER_SECOND, max_burst_kbps=constants.LIMIT_KILO_BITS_PER_SECOND) common_utils.wait_until_true( lambda: self._check_bw( ssh_client, self.fip['floating_ip_address'], port=self.NC_PORT),
deleted_lines: def test_qos(self): policy_id, max_kbps=constants.LIMIT_KILO_BITS_PER_SECOND, max_burst_kbps=constants.LIMIT_KILO_BYTES, policy_id, max_kbps=constants.LIMIT_KILO_BITS_PER_SECOND, max_burst_kbps=constants.LIMIT_KILO_BYTES, policy_id) self.assertEqual(2, len(rules['bandwidth_limit_rules'])) common_utils.wait_until_true(lambda: self._check_bw( ssh_client, self.fip['floating_ip_address'], port=self.NC_PORT),

commit_message:
Make our L3 resources TrackedResource

To workaround quota_details breakage for CountableResource.

This change is a copy-and-paste from networking-ovn. [1]

[1] I50dcb05d3d58ee6c23e59861d76da3c3ef83022b

Closes-Bug: #1714769
Change-Id: I4c9967cb0f5f33ea7ca5ccf1e66b72cc77b8984a

commit_message:
Add bindep.txt to fix unit tests

The unit tests fail since no mysqladmin command is installed, add
bindep.txt to install the needed binaries in our CI environment.

Add also the usual bindep tox environment for developers.

This commit includes the following unrelated changes
to pass the gate.
------------------------------------------------------------
Fix versions of neutron and friends

Change-Id: I0a98a0b39f9d39419dc81344423655fd03165648
------------------------------------------------------------
Update sphinx requirements

After the recent change in the global requirements. [1]

[1] If558f184c959e4b63b56dec3ca1571d1034cfe5c

Closes-Bug: #1829118
Change-Id: I41ffeebb52d094d85089fd74b89505a0e73535b1
(cherry picked from commit f1a7fccd98d1d463f06be2fb30d5c40c36f5617c)
(cherry picked from commit e855f2b8d1f0925405fca6777405836ee88a836d)
------------------------------------------------------------

Co-Authored-By: YAMAMOTO Takashi <yamamoto@midokura.com>

Change-Id: Ie49b7703dbe5ebf66d9c0abd1bee830044f6b71b
(cherry picked from commit 5a978840f0c9550b8fa51f84c67c5649caf0ae37)
(cherry picked from commit 4c1ce091ca662c65b45c78b7cc807654c59e8854)

added_lines: # This environment can be used to quickly validate that all needed system # packages required to successfully execute test targets are installed [testenv:bindep] basepython = python3 # Do not install any requirements. We want this to be fast and work even if # system dependencies are missing, since it's used to tell you what system # dependencies are missing! This also means that bindep must be installed # separately, outside of the requirements files. deps = bindep commands = bindep test

commit_message:
Add bindep.txt to fix unit tests

The unit tests fail since no mysqladmin command is installed, add
bindep.txt to install the needed binaries in our CI environment.

Add also the usual bindep tox environment for developers.

Change-Id: Ie49b7703dbe5ebf66d9c0abd1bee830044f6b71b
(cherry picked from commit 5a978840f0c9550b8fa51f84c67c5649caf0ae37)
(cherry picked from commit 4c1ce091ca662c65b45c78b7cc807654c59e8854)
(cherry picked from commit f6e31fd8f5fe9e62220eded32abf182cd7ced0d7)
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/networking-midonet refs/changes/57/668857/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # This environment can be used to quickly validate that all needed system # packages required to successfully execute test targets are installed [testenv:bindep] basepython = python3 # Do not install any requirements. We want this to be fast and work even if # system dependencies are missing, since it's used to tell you what system # dependencies are missing! This also means that bindep must be installed # separately, outside of the requirements files. deps = bindep commands = bindep test

commit_message:
Update master for stable/victoria

Add file to the reno documentation build to show release notes for
stable/victoria.

Use pbr instruction to increment the minor version number
automatically so that master versions are higher than the versions on
stable/victoria.

Change-Id: I09f54e58239b6c2e77f69bff07bc7fe72ce4690d
Sem-Ver: feature

commit_message:
Introducing networking-odl v2 driver for TapAsaService feature

Change-Id: Iddc36d82868c62a619ae40e8ccc97df5617f9b35
Signed-off-by: Yenuganti Vasudha <yenuganti.vasudha@ericsson.com>

added_lines: # # Copyright (C) 2019 Ericsson India Global Services Pvt Ltd. # # Licensed under the Apache License, Version 2.0 (the "License"); you may # not use this file except in compliance with the License. You may obtain # a copy of the License at # # http://www.apache.org/licenses/LICENSE-2.0 # # Unless required by applicable law or agreed to in writing, software # distributed under the License is distributed on an "AS IS" BASIS, WITHOUT # WARRANTIES OR CONDITIONS OF ANY KIND, either express or implied. See the # License for the specific language governing permissions and limitations # under the License. # from oslo_config import cfg from neutron_taas.services.taas import service_drivers from networking_odl.journal import full_sync from networking_odl.journal import journal from oslo_log import log as logging from oslo_log import helpers as log_helpers from networking_odl.common import constants as odl_const from networking_odl.common import postcommit from neutron_lib import context as nl_context from networking_odl.common import odl_features cfg.CONF.import_group('ml2_odl', 'networking_odl.common.config') LOG = logging.getLogger(__name__) TAAS_RESOURCES = { odl_const.ODL_TAP_SERVICE: odl_const.ODL_TAP_SERVICES, odl_const.ODL_TAP_FLOW: odl_const.ODL_TAP_FLOWS } class OpenDaylightTaasDriver(service_drivers.TaasBaseDriver): """OpenDaylight TAAS Driver This code is the backend implementation for the OpenDaylight TAAS driver for Openstack Neutron. """ @log_helpers.log_method_call def __init__(self, service_plugin): LOG.info("Initializing OpenDaylight TAAS v2 driver") super(OpenDaylightTaasDriver, self).__init__(service_plugin) self.journal = journal.OpenDaylightJournalThread() journal.register_url_builder(odl_const.ODL_TAP_FLOW, self.tap_flow_url_builder) full_sync.register('TAAS', TAAS_RESOURCES, self.get_resources) @staticmethod def get_resources(context, resource_type): plugin = directory.get_plugin('TAAS') if resource_type == odl_const.ODL_TAP_SERVICE: obj_getter = getattr(plugin, 'get_%s' % TAAS_RESOURCES[resource_type]) return obj_getter(context) method_name = 'get_%s' % TAAS_RESOURCES[resource_type] return full_sync.get_resources_require_id(plugin, context, plugin.get_tap_service, method_name) @log_helpers.log_method_call def create_tap_flow_precommit(self, context): tap_flow = context.tap_flow LOG.info("create_tap_flow_precommit for ID %s", tap_flow['id']) admin_context = nl_context.get_admin_context() journal.record(admin_context, odl_const.ODL_TAP_FLOW, tap_flow['id'], odl_const.ODL_CREATE, tap_flow) @log_helpers.log_method_call def create_tap_service_precommit(self, context): tap_service = context.tap_service LOG.info("create_tap_service_precommit for ID %s", tap_service['id']) admin_context = nl_context.get_admin_context() journal.record(admin_context, odl_const.ODL_TAP_SERVICE, tap_service['id'], odl_const.ODL_CREATE, tap_service) @log_helpers.log_method_call def delete_tap_flow_precommit(self, context): tap_flow = context.tap_flow LOG.info("create_tap_service_precommit for ID %s", tap_flow['id']) admin_context = nl_context.get_admin_context() if odl_features.odl_neutron_reachable(): journal.record(admin_context, odl_const.ODL_TAP_FLOW, tap_flow['id'], odl_const.ODL_DELETE, tap_flow) else: LOG.error("Delete tap_flow %s is ignored since the ODL is not" + " reachable.", tap_flow['id']) raise nlib_ex.ServiceUnavailable() @log_helpers.log_method_call def delete_tap_service_precommit(self, context): tap_service = context.tap_service LOG.info("create_tap_service_precommit for ID %s", tap_service['id']) admin_context = nl_context.get_admin_context() if odl_features.odl_neutron_reachable(): journal.record(admin_context, odl_const.ODL_TAP_SERVICE, tap_service['id'], odl_const.ODL_DELETE, []) else: LOG.error("Delete tap_service %s is ignored since the ODL is not" + " reachable.", tap_flow['id']) raise nlib_ex.ServiceUnavailable() @log_helpers.log_method_call def create_tap_flow_postcommit(self, context): tap_flow = context.tap_flow LOG.info("create_tap_flow_postcommit for ID %s", tap_flow['id']) self.journal.set_sync_event() @log_helpers.log_method_call def create_tap_service_postcommit(self, context): tap_service = context.tap_service LOG.info("create_tap_service_postcommit for ID %s", tap_service['id']) self.journal.set_sync_event() @log_helpers.log_method_call def delete_tap_flow_postcommit(self, context): tap_flow = context.tap_flow LOG.info("delete_tap_flow_postcommit for ID %s", tap_flow['id']) self.journal.set_sync_event() @log_helpers.log_method_call def delete_tap_service_postcommit(self, context): tap_service = context.tap_service LOG.info("delete_tap_service_postcommit for ID %s", tap_service['id']) self.journal.set_sync_event() @staticmethod def tap_flow_url_builder(row): if row.operation == odl_const.ODL_CREATE: return ("tap-flows/%s/flows" % row.data[odl_const.ODL_TAP_SERVICE_ID]) else: return ("tap-flows/%s/flows/%s" % (row.data[odl_const.ODL_TAP_SERVICE_ID], row.object_uuid))

BGPVPN missing networks in ODL

processing from BGPVPN update requests to corresponding
bgpvpn_network_association / bgpvpn_router_association
CREATE/DELETE calls

commit_message:
(PoC)Classification field in Neutron DSCP

This patch is a PoC to demonstrate integration of
Neutron Classifier into Neutron QoS.
It extends the DSCP marking rule to accept an optional
arguement "classification_group_id" that creates a
unique pair with the "policy_id" so that multiple DSCP
marking rules can be added to a single policy so long
as the same policy and classification id are not
duplicated.

Change-Id: Ifd1c6409724e6c1f951ab5e3b103fc87ef31832e

commit_message:
Update TOX_CONSTRAINTS_FILE for stable/victoria

Update the URL to the upper-constraints file to point to the redirect
rule on releases.openstack.org so that anyone working on this branch
will switch to the correct upper-constraints list automatically when
the requirements repository branches.

Until the requirements repository has as stable/victoria branch, tests will
continue to use the upper-constraints list on master.

Change-Id: I7bc932a8b05492e17b97f9541005a6e806b9cc50

2020-09-23 20:08:28.911658 | ubuntu-bionic | WARNING  Couldn't open %p - No such file or directory [try:2]

commit_message:
ovn migration: Fix neutron server container name

Previously docker command used grep to search for neutron server
container. It used image name instead of container name. With the switch
to podman, it stopped working. This patch fixes the container name.

Change-Id: Id650c2e7ac427dd53ebaab4e6d95d54efc657e3f
Closes-bug: #1895108
Signed-off-by: Jakub Libosvar <libosvar@redhat.com>
(cherry picked from commit 4b30dc2330423fd9fe68a70f7b2e0c6f925ecda4)
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/networking-ovn refs/changes/11/754011/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

commit_message:
Disable dstat to enable tests on Ubuntu 20.04

Apparently dstat's bug causing it to show that kuryr-daemon is using
1 TB of RAM causes some buffer overflow in Python 3.8. We need to
disable it in order to enable testing on Ubuntu Focal.

Change-Id: Ifacc8c5f3e4a7adc010de75923d69f1df615450a

commit_message:
Fix setup.cfg keywords

author-email, home-page are aliases, replacing them for their final value

description-file -> long_description = file:

requires-python is old value and does not work, python-requires
is right metadata.

'python-requires' is introduced from PEP440 and requires-python was old value
in PEP345.
- https://packaging.python.org/guides/distributing-packages-using-setuptools/#python-requires
- https://www.python.org/dev/peps/pep-0345/#requires-python

Change-Id: I2d2cd5d660ef937bfe8445bae7cf6b279eb80b0f

commit_message:
Don't use ansible 2.10.0

It seems to have broken all jobs, let's not use it till we
fix those.

Also pin importlib-metadata 2.0.0 which is not compatible
with virtualenv 20.0.31.

Related-Bug: #1896738
Change-Id: I696605e312692b24059178b82446d947023f35d9

commit_message:
Update TOX_CONSTRAINTS_FILE for stable/victoria

Update the URL to the upper-constraints file to point to the redirect
rule on releases.openstack.org so that anyone working on this branch
will switch to the correct upper-constraints list automatically when
the requirements repository branches.

Until the requirements repository has as stable/victoria branch, tests will
continue to use the upper-constraints list on master.

Change-Id: I3b27b7fab319c7948dd01b4270d6ec6bf675db96
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/neutron-vpnaas-dashboard refs/changes/11/753611/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

commit_message:
Add BIOS factory reset issue for boot mode

Change-Id: I6d13b7a4572703fcb415286ca6a86a502101ddbc
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/ironic refs/changes/95/754395/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: Boot mode reset with "factory_reset" BIOS clean/deploy step ----------------------------------------------------------- When using non-default boot mode and executing BIOS factory reset, then clean or deploy will fail as it is not possible to PXE boot with existing PXE configuration to continue clean or deploy. This applies to both BIOS and UEFI boot modes. For now, the workaround when doing BIOS factory reset is to use default boot mode or manually restore necessary boot mode when it is reset. .. _Ironic_RAID: https://docs.openstack.org/ironic/latest/admin/raid.html .. _iDRAC: https://www.dell.com/idracmanuals

commit_message:
Document MD5 as the image checksum algo

This corrects the documentation, the checksum field maps to Ironic
instance_info.image_checksum which uses MD5, not SHA256.

See https://docs.openstack.org/ironic/latest/install/standalone.html#populating-instance-info

Change-Id: Idcde577307e35e27dcca322892d44ef12994c787
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/tripleo-docs refs/changes/78/752578/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: * ``checksum``: When the ``href`` is a URL, the ``MD5`` checksum of the root
deleted_lines: * ``checksum``: When the ``href`` is a URL, the ``SHA512`` checksum of the root

commit_message:
use featureset config to toggle build_containers

deployments.  Build the containers prior to

commit_message:
libvirt: make mdev types name attribute be optional

Some GPU drivers like i915 don't provide a name attribute for mdev types.
As we don't use this attribute yet, let's just make sure we support the fact
it's optional.

Change-Id: Ia745ed7095c74e2bfba38379e623a3f81e7799eb
Closes-Bug: #1896741
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/nova refs/changes/74/753574/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: "pci_0000_06_00_1": """ <device> <name>pci_0000_06_00_1</name> <path>/sys/devices/pci0000:00/0000:00:06.1</path> <parent></parent> <driver> <name>i915</name> </driver> <capability type="pci"> <domain>0</domain> <bus>6</bus> <slot>0</slot> <function>1</function> <product id="0x591d">HD Graphics P630</product> <vendor id="0x8086">Intel Corporation</vendor> <capability type='mdev_types'> <type id='i915-GVTg_V5_8'> <deviceAPI>vfio-pci</deviceAPI> <availableInstances>2</availableInstances> </type> </capability> </capability> </device>""", def test_get_mdev_capabilities_for_dev_name_optional( self, device_lookup_by_name): # We use another PCI device that doesn't provide a name attribute for # each mdev type. def fake_nodeDeviceLookupByName(name): return FakeNodeDevice(_fake_NodeDevXml[name]) device_lookup_by_name.side_effect = fake_nodeDeviceLookupByName drvr = libvirt_driver.LibvirtDriver(fake.FakeVirtAPI(), False) expected = {"dev_id": "pci_0000_06_00_1", "vendor_id": 0x8086, "types": {'i915-GVTg_V5_8': {'availableInstances': 2, 'name': None, 'deviceAPI': 'vfio-pci'}, } } self.assertEqual( expected, drvr._get_mdev_capabilities_for_dev("pci_0000_06_00_1")) @mock.patch.object(host.Host, 'device_lookup_by_name')

commit_message:
Replace deprecated auth_plugin by auth_type

The auth_plugin parameter was deprecated a while ago in keystoneauth
and should be replaced by auth_type. This patch updates the parameter
accordingly.

[1] https://github.com/openstack/keystoneauth/commit/a56ed4218aef5a2e528aa682cea967e767dca923

Change-Id: If8289993f494ebebdc125a71cc482b658acf4d51
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/puppet-swift refs/changes/10/754010/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: it { is_expected.to contain_swift_proxy_config('filter:authtoken/auth_type').with_value('password') } it { is_expected.to contain_swift_proxy_config('filter:authtoken/auth_plugin').with_ensure('absent') } it { is_expected.to contain_swift_proxy_config('filter:authtoken/auth_type').with_value('password') } it { is_expected.to contain_swift_proxy_config('filter:authtoken/auth_plugin').with_ensure('absent') }

commit_message:
Fix keystone-startup.sh

keystone-startup.sh is using fernet_token_expiry instead of
fernet_key_rotation_interval - which effects in restart loop of keystone
containers - when restarted after 2-3 days.

Closes-Bug: #1895723

Change-Id: Ifff77af3d25d9dc659fff34f2ae3c6f2670df0f4

commit_message:
Check login in addtion to port reachability to make sure share server is available

When we start a share server,  we should make sure the server can be login
so that the later access to the server will success. Only check the port
reachable is not enough, especially when using private key to access a slow
share server, the immediately access after the port first available will fail.

Change-Id: I7bdc267eedaf3a43fcb6bfdecbb5863129a9ac5b
Closes-Bug: 1748139

commit_message:
Add OPENSTACK_ENDPOINT_TYPE to the connection

Pass interface to honor 'OPENSTACK_ENDPOINT_TYPE' so it can have multiple endpoints,
without this it only communicate with the public endpoint.

Closes-Bug: #1891230
Change-Id: I7caf9170d63eff388af5d690dd6b054188752381
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/masakari-dashboard refs/changes/82/745882/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2020-09-23 10:17:10.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/openstack-virtual-baremetal/commit/cd5a607e730d2c51b9744c69e9ffba9b9c315478', 'message': 'Add allocation-pool support for the public_net

Adding support to define the allocation pools on the

https://review.opendev.org/#/c/733598/ added support
of allocation_pools, but set type of public_net_allocation_pools
to comma_delimited_list which causes below issue because for
comma_delimited_list, list items are converted to string:-

We need to use type: json to get it work, this patch fixes it.

commit_message:
Add allocation-pool support for the public_net

TripleO CI uses 10.0.0.1 statically for the undercloud's
public interface. When using extra node in some job's
there is sometime a conflict, because the extra node get's
the 10.0.0.1 address allocated.

Adding support to define the allocation pools on the
public_net allows TripleO CI to define a pool with the
10.0.0.1 address eliminated.

A good practice would be to set up OVB to use
[{start: 10.0.0.128, end: 10.0.0.253}], and then configure
the undercloud/overcloud deployed on the OVB infrastructure
to use addresses in the range 10.0.0.1-10.0.0.127.

The parameter public_net_allocation_pools controls the
allocation pool setting, by default all addresses of the
subnet is in the pool.

Related-Bug: #1874418
Change-Id: Ieca4864e069148abb49eb709bf7f48a14ef04e77
(cherry picked from commit ccec11f9c870a49909255b1d67f1f5042993de0e)

Fix type of public_net_allocation_pools

https://review.opendev.org/#/c/733598/ added support
of allocation_pools, but set type of public_net_allocation_pools
to comma_delimited_list which causes below issue because for
comma_delimited_list, list items are converted to string:-

Property error: : resources.public_subnet.properties.allocation_pools[0]:
"{'end': '10.0.0.199', 'start': '10.0.0.128'}" is not a map

We need to use type: json to get it work, this patch fixes it.

Related-Bug: #1874418
Change-Id: Iaebb297e5018ce8db6dd1f67a308e7707117fe03
(cherry picked from commit ff4d8fa4e27622ef2b08db10f8d7eafaa397166a)
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/openstack-virtual-baremetal refs/changes/66/753566/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # Allocation Pools for the public network # Type: comma_delimited_list public_net_allocation_pools: [] # CIDR for external network subnet # Type: string public_net_cidr: 10.0.0.0/24 # IP version for the public subnet # Type: number public_net_ip_version: 4

commit_message:
Update TOX_CONSTRAINTS_FILE for stable/victoria

Update the URL to the upper-constraints file to point to the redirect
rule on releases.openstack.org so that anyone working on this branch
will switch to the correct upper-constraints list automatically when
the requirements repository branches.

Until the requirements repository has as stable/victoria branch, tests will
continue to use the upper-constraints list on master.

Change-Id: Ie7836671e746b143b3f1fb91af1111df4945c8e4

commit_message:
Update TOX_CONSTRAINTS_FILE for stable/victoria

Update the URL to the upper-constraints file to point to the redirect
rule on releases.openstack.org so that anyone working on this branch
will switch to the correct upper-constraints list automatically when
the requirements repository branches.

Until the requirements repository has as stable/victoria branch, tests will
continue to use the upper-constraints list on master.

Change-Id: I73b04d5639ceccb4880f48445f921912792fa5be

commit_message:
Add a note about enable-ssh-admin and plan_name

Inform the users that the plan_name need to be set if the stack name
isn't "overcloud".

Depends-On: https://review.opendev.org/753095
Change-Id: I1e25acca55a32ec73afb8597fdc9f562d7f32789

commit_message:
enable-ssh-admin: allow to override plan name

By default, the overcloud plan name is "overcloud" but it can be renamed
if the stack is named directly. Allowing the operator to override it so
they can run that script on a deployment where the stack is named
differently than the default.

Change-Id: I05029d30447592d4e16d85acc490cda69b101e9c
Closes-Bug: #1896505

commit_message:
Show instance networking info

Instance details page now contains following information:
* is the instance public or not
* Allowed CIDRs
* IP address type (private/public)

Change-Id: I153c1a9459748c1686ef5df1afa253bae7da0fa1

{% for cidr in instance.access.allowed_cidrs %} {% if not forloop.last %} {{ cidr }},  {% else %} {{ cidr }} {% endif %} {% endfor %}
{% else %}

{% endif %} {% for addr in instance.addresses %}
{{ addr.type }}
{{ addr.address }}
{% endfor %}
{% endif %}

commit_message:
Add Access Rules tests

Access rules for application credentials were added in the Train release
of keystone. This change adds related CRUD tests for access rules. See
the API reference for additional information[1].

[1] https://docs.openstack.org/api-ref/identity/v3/index.html#application-credentials

Change-Id: Ifd4ff2245277c2c57f5ccf450923434c0277a724
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/tempest refs/changes/19/699519/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # Copyright 2019 SUSE LLC # # All Rights Reserved. # # Licensed under the Apache License, Version 2.0 (the "License"); you may # not use this file except in compliance with the License. You may obtain # a copy of the License at # # http://www.apache.org/licenses/LICENSE-2.0 # # Unless required by applicable law or agreed to in writing, software # distributed under the License is distributed on an "AS IS" BASIS, WITHOUT # WARRANTIES OR CONDITIONS OF ANY KIND, either express or implied. See the # License for the specific language governing permissions and limitations # under the License. """ https://docs.openstack.org/api-ref/identity/v3/index.html#application-credentials """ from oslo_serialization import jsonutils as json from six.moves.urllib import parse as urllib from tempest.lib.common import rest_client class AccessRulesClient(rest_client.RestClient): api_version = "v3" def show_access_rule(self, user_id, access_rule_id): """Gets details of an access rule. For a full list of available parameters, please refer to the official API reference: https://docs.openstack.org/api-ref/identity/v3/index.html#show-access-rule-details """ resp, body = self.get('users/%s/access_rules/%s' % (user_id, access_rule_id)) self.expected_success(200, resp.status) body = json.loads(body) return rest_client.ResponseBody(resp, body) def list_access_rules(self, user_id, **params): """Lists out all of a user's access rules. For a full list of available parameters, please refer to the official API reference: https://docs.openstack.org/api-ref/identity/v3/index.html#list-access-rules """ url = 'users/%s/access_rules' % user_id if params: url += '?%s' % urllib.urlencode(params) resp, body = self.get(url) self.expected_success(200, resp.status) body = json.loads(body) return rest_client.ResponseBody(resp, body) def delete_access_rule(self, user_id, access_rule_id): """Deletes an access rule. For a full list of available parameters, please refer to the official API reference: https://docs.openstack.org/api-ref/identity/v3/index.html#delete-access-rule """ resp, body = self.delete('users/%s/access_rules/%s' % (user_id, access_rule_id)) self.expected_success(204, resp.status) return rest_client.ResponseBody(resp, body)

commit_message:
Add openstack overcloud export ceph

Add a new command to export Ceph information from one or
more Heat stacks to be used as input of another stack.
Creates a valid YAML file with the CephExternalMultiConfig
parameter populated.

Also have export's export_password use yaml.safe_load in
place of the deprecated yaml.load.

Closes-Bug: #1895034
Change-Id: Ibdf9115e92c6b476b99d6df785b0c7e9f23991de
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/python-tripleoclient refs/changes/12/750812/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # Licensed under the Apache License, Version 2.0 (the "License"); you may # not use this file except in compliance with the License. You may obtain # a copy of the License at # # http://www.apache.org/licenses/LICENSE-2.0 # # Unless required by applicable law or agreed to in writing, software # distributed under the License is distributed on an "AS IS" BASIS, WITHOUT # WARRANTIES OR CONDITIONS OF ANY KIND, either express or implied. See the # License for the specific language governing permissions and limitations # under the License. from datetime import datetime import logging import os.path import yaml from osc_lib.i18n import _ from osc_lib import utils from tripleoclient import command from tripleoclient import export class ExportOvercloudCeph(command.Command): """Export stack information about ceph used as import of another stack""" log = logging.getLogger(__name__ + ".ExportOvercloudCeph") now = datetime.now().strftime('%Y%m%d%H%M%S') def get_parser(self, prog_name): parser = super(ExportOvercloudCeph, self).get_parser(prog_name) # todo(fultonj): make this support multiple stacks parser.add_argument('--stack', dest='stack', metavar='<stack>', help=_('Name of the environment main Heat stack ' 'to export Ceph information from. ' '(default=Env: OVERCLOUD_STACK_NAME)'), default=utils.env('OVERCLOUD_STACK_NAME', default='overcloud')) parser.add_argument('--output-file', '-o', metavar='<output file>', help=_('Name of the output file for the Ceph ' 'data export. It will default to ' '"<name>.yaml"')) parser.add_argument('--force-overwrite', '-f', action='store_true', default=False, help=_('Overwrite output file if it exists.')) parser.add_argument('--config-download-dir', action='store', help=_('Directory to search for config-download ' 'export data. Defaults to ' '$HOME/config-download')) return parser def take_action(self, parsed_args): self.log.debug("take_action(%s)" % parsed_args) stack = parsed_args.stack output_file = parsed_args.output_file or \ '%s-ceph-export.yaml' % stack self.log.info('Running at %s with parameters %s', self.now, parsed_args) if os.path.exists(output_file) and not parsed_args.force_overwrite: raise Exception( "File '%s' already exists, not exporting." % output_file) if not parsed_args.config_download_dir: config_download_dir = os.path.join(os.environ.get('HOME'), 'config-download') else: config_download_dir = parsed_args.config_download_dir # prepare clients to access the environment clients = self.app.client_manager swift_client = clients.tripleoclient.object_store data = export.export_ceph(swift_client, stack) data.update(export.export_stack( clients.orchestration, stack, False, config_download_dir)) data = dict(parameter_defaults=data) # write the exported data with open(output_file, 'w') as f: yaml.safe_dump(data, f, default_flow_style=False) print("Stack information about Ceph exported to %s." % output_file)

commit_message:
Proposing victoria RC1 for mistral

As a courtesy for project teams, on RC1 week the release management
team proposes a RC1 release for all cycle-with-rc deliverables,
based on HEAD. That RC1 will double as the branch point for the
stable/victoria branch for mistral.

Release liaison or PTL should +1 this proposal if they are happy
with it, amend this proposal (for example with a more recent SHA)
to match their needs, or -1 to block it until release-critical
issues are all fixed.

Change-Id: Ib411d6cda54f6b09cab3e47bd6a4734a5dbe6818
Signed-off-by: Thierry Carrez <thierry@openstack.org>

commit_message:
Remove six.PY3

The Python 2.7 Support has been dropped since Ussuri.
So remove hacking rules for compatibility between python 2 and 3.

Change-Id: I7f6331a74ad7a51c473ce28a9dd880db92b47d3c
